. O

segregated O
account O
for O
each O
specified O
series O
of O
securities O
was O
in O
existence O
prior O
to O
the O
time O
the O
deposits O
were O
to O
be O
made O
into O
such O
account O
but O
such O
account O
was O
not O
utilized O
in O
all O
instances O
by O
the O
Trustee O
as O
stated O
above O
. O

However O
" " O
payments O
related O
to O
each O
specified O
series O
of O
securities O
were O
timely O
remitted O
to O
the O
investors O
in O
such O
series O
. O

Existing O
procedures O
have O
been O
reviewed O
with O
staff O
to O
enable O
future O
payments O
to O
be O
deposited O
into O
the O
segregated O

for O
each O
specified O
series O
within O
the O
applicable O

. O

Management O
is O

for O

with O
the O

. O

Our O

to O

. O

of O

matter O
and O
has O
not O
been O
instructed O
on O
how O
to O
vote O
( O

broker O

) O
" " O

will O
be O
considered O
as O
present O
and O
entitled O
to O
vote O
for O

. O

rules O
" " O

of O

" " O

" " O

6 O

from O

" " O

" " O

Our O
Board O
of O
Directors O
has O
adopted O
Corporate O
Governance O
Guidelines O
. O

These O
guidelines O
address O
the O
make-up O
and O
functioning O
of O
the O
Board O
of O
Directors O
and O
its O
committees O
" " O
which O
include O

director O
independence O
" " O
criteria O
for O
Board O
membership O
" " O
and O
authority O
to O
retain O
independent O
advisors O
. O

Our O
Board O
of O
Directors O
has O
also O
adopted O
a O
Code O
of O
Conduct O
" " O
which O
applies O
to O
all O
of O
our O
Board O
members O
and O
all O
of O
our O
officers O
and O
employees O
. O

The O
code O
sets O
forth O
and O
summarizes O
certain O
of O
our O
policies O
related O
to O
legal O
compliance O
and O
honest O
and O
ethical O
business O
practices O
. O

The O
code O
is O
intended O
to O
comply O
with O
the O
standards O
set O
forth O
in O
Section O
303A.10 O
of O
the O
NYSE I-ORG
s O
Listed I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Company I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Manual I-LEGISLATION/ACT
and O
SEC I-GOVERNMENT
rules O
and O
regulations O
. O

Any O

to O
" " O
or O

from O
" " O

of O

of O

that O
apply O
to O

" " O

. O

On O
an O
annual O
basis O
our O
Board O
of O
Directors O
reviews O
the O
independence O
of O
all O
directors O
and O
affirmatively O
makes O
a O
determination O
as O
to O
the O
independence O
of O
each O
director O
. O

For O
a O
director O
to O
be O
considered O
independent O
" " O
the O
Board O
must O
determine O
that O
the O
director O
does O
not O
have O
any O
direct O
or O
indirect O
material O
relationship O
with O
Watson I-ORG
. O

To O
assist O
in O
making O
this O
determination O
" " O
the O
Board O
has O
adopted O
independence O
guidelines O
" " O
which O
are O
designed O
to O
conform O
to O
" " O
or O
be O
more O
exacting O
than O
" " O
the O
independence O
requirements O
set O
forth O
in O
the O
listing O
standards O
of O
the O
NYSE I-ORG
. O

You O
may O
find O
these O
guidelines O
on O
our O
website O
at O
www.watson.com O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
applying O
these O
guidelines O
" " O
the O
Board O
considers O
any O
and O
all O
additional O
relevant O
facts O
and O
circumstances O
in O
making O
an O
independence O
determination O
. O

Our O
Board O
has O
determined O
that O
at O

a O
majority O
of O
its O
directors O

no O
direct O
or O

with O

( O

director O

and O

are O

within O

( O
i O

The O

that O

and O

on O

of O

annual O

" " O

" " O

and O

Each O
year O

to O

to O

" " O

" " I-ORG

In O

to O

) O

Section O
162 O
( O

) O
of O

IRC I-LEGISLATION/ACT

" " O

Section O
409A O
of O
the O
IRC I-LEGISLATION/ACT
requires O
that O

deferred O
and O
paid O
under O

or O

that O

" " O

of O

. O

and O

and O

. O

Accordingly O
" " O

" " O

" " O

" " O
Section O

. O

" " O

) O

Sections O
280G O
and O
4999 O
of O
the O
IRC I-LEGISLATION/ACT
impose O
certain O
adverse O
tax O
consequences O
on O
compensation O
treated O
as O
excess O
parachute O
payments O
. O

An O
executive O
is O
treated O
as O
having O
received O
excess O
parachute O
payments O
if O
he O
receives O
compensatory O
payments O
or O
benefits O
that O
are O
contingent O
on O
a O
change-in-control O
" " O
and O
the O
aggregate O
amount O
of O
such O
payments O
and O
benefits O
equal O
or O
exceeds O
three O
times O
the O
executive O
s O
base O
amount O
. O

The O
portion O
of O
the O
payments O
and O
benefits O
in O
excess O
of O
one O
times O
base O
amount O
are O
treated O
as O
excess O
parachute O
payments O
and O
are O
subject O
to O
a O
20 O
% O
excise O
tax O
" " O
in O
addition O
to O
any O
applicable O
federal O
income O
and O
employment O
taxes O
. O

Also O
" " O
our O
compensation O
deduction O
in O
respect O
of O
the O
executive O
s O
excess O
parachute O
payments O
is O
disallowed O
. O

If O
we O
were O
to O
be O
subject O
to O
a O
change-in-control O
" " O
certain O
amounts O
received O
by O
our O
executives O
( O
for O
example O
" " O
amounts O
attributable O
to O
the O
accelerated O
vesting O
of O
stock O
options O
) O
could O
be O
excess O
parachute O
payments O
under O
Sections O

Our O

provide O
that O

Directors O

. O

One O

" " O

" " O

In O

of O
recent O
developments O
in O
corporate O
governance O
" " O
the O

of O
Directors O
carefully O

a O

of O
directors O
. O

As O
a O

of O
this O

" " O
the O

of O
Directors O
has O
determined O
that O

classified O

of O
directors O
is O
no O
longer O
in O
the O
best O
interests O
of O
the O
Company O
and O
its O
stockholders O
. O

The O
Board O
of O
Directors O
believes O
that O
all O
directors O
should O
be O
equally O
accountable O
at O
all O
times O
for O
the O
Company O
s O
performance O
and O
subject O
each O
year O
to O

of O
our O

regarding O
their O

as O
a O
director O
. O

The O
following O
description O
of O
the O
Dover I-MISC
Corporation I-MISC
Retirement I-MISC

Plan I-MISC
( O

“ O
Plan O
” O

only O

. O

This O

Plan O

plan O
established O
to O
encourage O
and O

and O

of O

and O

( O
“ O
Dover I-ORG
” O
) O
. O

Plan O
is O
subject O
to O
the O
provisions O
of O
the O
Employee I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Retirement I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Income I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Security I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Act I-LEGISLATION/ACT
of I-LEGISLATION/ACT
1974 I-LEGISLATION/ACT
" " O
as O
amended O
( O
“ O
ERISA I-LEGISLATION/ACT
” O
) O
. O

Pension I-MISC
Plans I-MISC
. O

The O
ASU I-LEGISLATION/ACT
requires O
that O
loans O
should O
be O
classified O
as O
notes O
receivable O
from O
participants O
and O
measured O
at O
their O
unpaid O
principal O
balance O
" " O
plus O
any O
accrued O
but O
unpaid O
interest O
. O

Previously O
" " O
participant O
loans O
were O
classified O
as O
investments O
that O
are O
recognized O
at O
fair O
value O
in O
accordance O
with O
Accounting I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Standards I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Codification I-LEGISLATION/ACT
( O
“ O
ASC I-LEGISLATION/ACT
” O
) O
962-325 O
. O

This O
guidance O
is O
effective O
for O
reporting O
periods O
ending O
after O
December O
15 O
" " O
2010 O
and O
is O
to O
be O
applied O
retrospectively O
to O
all O
periods O
presented O
comparatively O
. O

The O
adoption O
of O
this O
guidance O
by O
the O
Plan O
resulted O
in O
the O
reclassification O
from O
investments O
to O
notes O
receivable O
from O
participants O
of O
$ O
"27,478" O
on O
the O
Statement O
of O
Net O
Assets O
Available O
for O

as O
of O
December O
31 O
" " O
2009 O
. O

The O
adoption O
had O
no O
effect O
on O
the O
Plan O
’ O
s O
net O
assets O
available O
for O
benefits O
. O

The O
Plan O
’ O
s O
investments O
are O
reported O
at O
fair O
value O
( O
see O
Note O
4 O
) O
. O

Investments O
in O
common O
shares O
of O
Dover I-ORG
are O
valued O
at O
the O
closing O
market O
price O
on O
the O
last O
business O
day O
of O
the O
Plan O
year O
based O
on O
quotations O
from O
national O
securities O
exchanges O
. O

The O
fair O
value O
of O
investments O
in O
registered O
mutual O
funds O
are O
obtained O
from O
quoted O
prices O
on O
national O
securities O
exchanges O
. O

The O
fair O
value O
of O
investments O
in O
collective O
funds O
and O
pooled O
separate O
accounts O
are O
based O
on O
the O
net O
asset O
values O
as O
of O
the O
last O
business O
day O
of O
the O
Plan O
year O
as O
determined O
by O
their O
respective O
investment O
managers O
and O
recent O
transaction O
prices O
. O

Purchases O
and O
sales O
of O
investment O
securities O
are O
reflected O
on O
a O
trade-date O
basis O
. O

Gains O
and O
losses O
on O
sales O
of O
investment O
securities O
are O
determined O
on O
the O
average O
cost O
method O
. O

Funds O
temporarily O
awaiting O
investment O
are O
placed O
in O
a O
short-term O
investment O
fund O
of O
the O
Trustee O
where O
they O
earn O
the O
prevailing O
market O
rate O
of O
interest O
. O

Dividend O
income O
is O
recorded O
on O
the O
ex-dividend O
date O
. O

Interest O
income O
from O
other O
investments O
is O
recorded O
as O
earned O
. O

The O
Plan O
presents O
in O
the O
Statement O
of O
Changes O
in O
Net O
Assets O
Available O
for O

the O
net O
appreciation O
or O

in O

of O
its O
investments O
which O
consists O
of O
the O

or O

the O

appreciation O
or O

on O
those O
investments O
. O

Notes O
receivable O
from O
participants O
are O
reported O
at O
their O
unpaid O
principal O
balance O
plus O
any O
accrued O
but O
unpaid O
interest O
with O
no O
allowance O
for O
credit O
losses O
" " O
as O

principal O
and O
interest O
are O
received O
through O

deductions O
and O
the O
notes O
are O
collateralized O
by O
the O
participants O
’ O
account O
balances O
. O

The O
preparation O
of O
financial O
statements O
in O
conformity O
with O
accounting I-LEGISLATION/ACT
principles I-LEGISLATION/ACT
generally I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accepted I-LEGISLATION/ACT
in O
the O
United I-LOC
States I-LOC
of I-LOC
America I-LOC
requires O
management O
to O
make O

and O

that O

and O

of O

" " O

and O

therein O
" " O
and O
disclosure O
of O
contingent O
assets O
and O

. O

Actual O
results O
could O
differ O
from O
those O
estimates O
. O

Certain O
amounts O
in O
the O
prior O
year O
have O
been O
reclassified O
to O
conform O
to O
current O
year O
presentation O
. O

The O
Plan O
provides O
for O
various O

options O
in O

of O
stocks O
" " O

" " O

. O

Investment O
securities O
are O
exposed O
to O
various O
risks O
" " O
including O
" " O
but O
not O
limited O
to O
" " O
interest O
rate O
" " O
market O
" " O

and O

. O

Due O
to O
the O
level O
of O

associated O
with O

and O
the O

" " O

is O
at O

that O

" " O

22.61 O
% O

" " O

market O

greater O
than O
the O
market O

of O
the O

in O

The I-ORG
Aberdeen I-ORG
Small I-ORG
Cap I-ORG
Institutional I-ORG

seeks O

. O

. O

U.S. I-ORG

ASC I-LEGISLATION/ACT
820 O
" " O
Fair I-MISC
Value I-MISC
Measurements I-MISC
and I-MISC
Disclosures I-MISC
defines O
fair O
value O
as O
the O
price O
that O
would O
be O
received O
from O
selling O
an O
asset O
or O
paid O
to O
transfer O
a O
liability O
in O
an O
orderly O
transaction O
between O
market O
participants O
at O
the O
measurement O
date O
. O

When O
determining O
the O
fair O
value O
measurements O
for O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
required O
to O
be O
recorded O
at O
fair O
value O
" " O
the O
Plan O
considers O
the O
principal O
or O
most O
advantageous O
market O
in O
which O
it O
would O
transact O
and O
considers O
assumptions O
that O
market O
participants O
would O
use O
when O
pricing O
the O
asset O
or O
liability O
" " O
such O
as O
inherent O
risk O
" " O
transfer O
restrictions O
" " O
and O
risk O
of O

. O

ASC I-LEGISLATION/ACT
820 O
also O
establishes O
a O
fair O
value O
hierarchy O
that O
requires O

Plan O
to O

use O
of O

and O

the O
use O

. O

A O
financial O
instrument O
’ O
s O
categorization O
within O
the O
fair O
value O
hierarchy O
is O
based O
upon O
the O
lowest O
level O
of O
input O
that O
is O
significant O
to O
the O
fair O
value O
measurement O
. O

ASC I-LEGISLATION/ACT
820 O
establishes O

levels O

Level O
1 O

prices O
in O

for O
identical O

or O

. O

Mutual O
funds O
and O
Dover I-ORG

" " O

" " O

for O

Plan O

INVESTMENT O
OBJECTIVE O
James I-ORG
Long-Short I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
seeks O
to O
provide O
long-term O
capital O
appreciation O
. O

FEES I-MISC
AND I-MISC
EXPENSES I-MISC
OF I-MISC
THE I-MISC
FUND I-MISC
This O
table O
describes O
the O
fees O
and O
expenses O
that O
you O
may O
pay O
if O
you O
buy O
and O
hold O
shares O
of O
the O
Fund O
. O

ANNUAL I-MISC
FUND I-MISC
OPERATING I-MISC
EXPENSES I-MISC
( O
expenses O
that O
you O
pay O
each O
year O
as O
a O
percentage O
of O
the O
value O
of O
your O
investment O
) O

EXAMPLE I-MISC
The O
Example O
is O
intended O
to O
help O
you O
compare O
the O
cost O
of O
investing O
in O
the O
Fund O
with O
the O
cost O
of O
investing O
in O
other O
mutual O
funds O
. O

The O
Example O
assumes O
that O
you O
invest O
$ O
"10,000" O
in O
the O
Fund O
for O
the O
time O
period O
indicated O
and O
then O
redeem O
all O
of O
your O
shares O
at O
the O
end O
of O
those O
periods O
. O

The O
Example O
also O
assumes O
that O
your O
investment O
has O
a O
5 O
% O
return O
each O
year O
and O
that O
the O
Fund O
s O
operating O
expenses O
remain O
the O
same O
. O

Although O
your O
actual O
costs O
may O
be O
higher O
or O
lower O
" " O
based O
on O
these O
assumptions O
your O
costs O
would O
be O
: O

Portfolio O
Turnover O
: O
The O
Fund O
pays O
transaction O
costs O
" " O
such O
as O
commissions O
" " O
when O
it O
buys O
and O
sells O
securities O
( O
or O
turns O
over O
its O
portfolio O
) O
. O

A O
higher O
portfolio O
turnover O
may O
indicate O
higher O
transaction O
costs O
and O
may O
result O
in O
higher O
taxes O
when O
Fund O
shares O
are O
held O
in O
a O
taxable O
account O
. O

These O
costs O
" " O
which O
are O
not O
reflected O
in O
annual O
fund O
operating O
expenses O
or O
in O
the O
Example O
" " O
affect O
the O
Fund O
s O
performance O
. O

PRINCIPAL O
INVESTMENT O
STRATEGIES O
The O
Fund O
invests O
primarily O
in O
foreign O
and O
domestic O
equity O
securities O
( O
long O
positions O
) O
that O
the O
Adviser O
believes O
are O
undervalued O
and O
more O
likely O
to O
appreciate O
" " O
and O
sells O
short O
equity O
securities O
( O
short O
positions O
) O
that O
the O
Adviser O
believes O
are O
overvalued O
and O
more O
likely O
to O
depreciate O
. O

The O
Fund O
also O
may O
take O
long O
positions O
in O
domestic O
and O
foreign O
fixed O
income O
securities O
that O
the O
Adviser O
believes O
are O
more O
likely O
to O
appreciate O
in O
the O
interest O
rate O
and O
spread O
environment O
anticipated O
by O
the O
Adviser O
" " O
and O
short O
positions O
in O
fixed O
income O
securities O
that O
the O
Adviser O
believes O
are O
more O
likely O
to O
depreciate O
in O
the O
interest O
rate O
and O
spread O
environment O
anticipated O
by O
the O
Adviser O
. O

The O
Fund O
seeks O
to O
achieve O

on O
both O

and O
short O

that O

. O

At O

" " O

can O
have O

to O
a O
100 O
% O
exposure O
in O

or O

positions O
. O

" " O

( O

( O

. O

" " O

" " O

" " O

" " O

" " O

whose O

" " O
currencies O

. O

The O

may O
take O
long O
and O

positions O
in O
fixed O
income O
securities O
of O
any O

or O

. O

A O

of O

and O

may O
be O

in O

capitalization O
securities O
. O

The O
Fund O
is O
non-diversified O
" " O
which O
means O
that O
it O
can O
invest O
a O
relatively O
high O
percentage O
of O
its O
assets O
in O
a O
limited O
number O
of O
securities O
. O

The O
Adviser O
may O
sell O
a O
long O

or O
close O
out O
a O
short O
position O
because O
the O
Adviser O

that O

is O
not O

to O
achieve O
positive O

" " O
or O
that O
another O

is O
more O

to O

so O
. O

The O

may O

out O
a O

to O

" " O

of O

that O

too O
large O

. O

PRINCIPAL I-MISC
RISKS I-MISC
All O
investments O
carry O
a O
certain O
amount O
of O
risk O
and O
the O
Fund O
can O
not O
guarantee O
that O
it O
will O
achieve O
its O
investment O
objective O
. O

An O
investment O
in O
the O
Fund O
is O
not O
a O
deposit O
or O
obligation O
of O
any O
bank O
" " O
is O
not O
endorsed O
or O
guaranteed O
by O
any O
bank O
" " O
and O
is O
not O
insured O
by O
the O
Federal I-GOVERNMENT
Deposit I-GOVERNMENT
Insurance I-GOVERNMENT
Corporation I-GOVERNMENT
( O
FDIC O
) O
or O
any O
other O
government O
agency O
. O

You O
may O
lose O
money O
by O
investing O
in O
the O
Fund O
. O

Below O
are O
the O
main O
risks O
of O
investing O
in O
the O
Fund O
. O

Equity O
Market O
Risk O
: O
Overall O
stock O
market O
risks O
may O
affect O
the O
value O
of O
the O
Fund O
. O

Factors O
such O
as O
domestic O
economic O
growth O
and O
market O
conditions O
" " O
interest O
rate O
levels O
" " O
and O
political O
events O
affect O
the O
securities O
markets O
. O

When O
the O
value O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
investments O
goes O
down O
" " O
your O
investment O
in O
the O
Fund O
decreases O
in O
value O
and O
you O
could O
lose O
money O
. O

Fixed O
Income O
Risk O
: O
Fixed O
income O
securities O
are O
subject O
to O
inherent O
market O
risks O
and O
fluctuations O
in O
value O
due O
to O
changes O
in O
earnings O
" " O
economic O
conditions O
" " O
quality O
ratings O
and O
other O
factors O
beyond O
the O
control O
of O
the O
Adviser O
. O

These O
securities O
are O
also O
subject O
to O
price O
fluctuations O
based O
on O
changes O
in O
interest O
rates O
. O

If O
rates O
increase O
" " O
the O
value O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
fixed O
income O
securities O
generally O
will O
decline O
" " O
and O
those O
securities O
with O
longer O
terms O
generally O
will O
decline O
more O
. O

securities O
held O
by O
the O
Fund O
. O

Such O
defaults O
could O
result O
in O
losses O
to O
the O
Fund O
. O

Securities O
with O
lower O
credit O
quality O
have O
a O
greater O
risk O
of O
default O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
the O
credit O
quality O
of O
securities O
held O
by O
the O
Fund O
may O
be O
lowered O
if O
an O
issuer O
s O
financial O
condition O
changes O
. O

Lower O
credit O
quality O
may O
lead O
to O
greater O
volatility O
in O
the O
price O
of O
a O
security O
and O
in O
shares O
of O
the O
Fund O
. O

Lower O
credit O
quality O
also O
may O
affect O
liquidity O
and O
make O
it O
difficult O
for O
the O
Fund O
to O
sell O
the O
security O
. O

Management O
Risk O
: O
The O
Adviser O
s O
judgments O
about O
the O
attractiveness O
" " O
value O
and O
potential O
appreciation O
of O
a O
particular O
asset O
class O
or O
individual O
security O
in O
which O
the O
Fund O
invests O
may O
prove O
to O
be O
incorrect O
. O

If O
the O
Adviser O
does O
not O
correctly O
identify O
undervalued O
and O
overvalued O
equity O
securities O
" " O
or O
anticipate O
future O
interest O
rate O
and O
spread O
environments O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
experience O
losses O
regardless O
of O
the O
overall O
performance O
of O
the O
markets O
. O

Short O
Selling O
Risk O
: O
The O
Fund O
will O
incur O
a O
loss O
as O
a O
result O
of O
a O
short O
sale O
if O
the O
price O
of O
the O
security O
sold O
short O
increases O
in O
value O
between O
the O
date O
of O
the O
short O
sale O
and O
the O
date O
on O
which O
the O
Fund O
purchases O
the O
security O
to O
replace O
the O
borrowed O
security O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
a O
lender O
may O
request O
that O
securities O
sold O
short O
be O
returned O
to O
the O
lender O
on O
short O
notice O
" " O
in O
which O
case O
the O
Fund O
may O
have O
to O
buy O
the O
securities O
sold O
short O
at O
an O
unfavorable O
price O
. O

If O
this O
occurs O
" " O
any O
anticipated O
gain O
to O
the O
Fund O
may O
be O
reduced O
or O
eliminated O
or O
the O
short O
sale O
may O
result O
in O
a O
loss O
. O

The O
Fund O
s O
losses O
are O
potentially O
unlimited O
in O
a O
short O
sale O
transaction O
. O

Short O
sales O
are O
speculative O
transactions O
and O
involve O
special O
risks O
" " O
including O
greater O
reliance O
on O
the O
Adviser O
s O
ability O
to O
accurately O
anticipate O
the O
future O
value O
of O
a O
security O
. O

Smaller O
Cap O
Company O
Risk O
: O
Smaller O
capitalization O
companies O
may O
experience O
higher O
failure O
rates O
than O
do O
larger O
capitalization O
companies O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
smaller O
companies O
may O
be O
more O
vulnerable O
to O
economic O
" " O
market O
and O
industry O
changes O
. O

As O
a O
result O
" " O
share O
price O
changes O
may O
be O
more O
sudden O
or O
erratic O
than O
the O
prices O
of O
other O
equity O
securities O
" " O
especially O
over O
the O
short O
term O
. O

Such O
companies O
may O
have O
limited O
product O
lines O
" " O
markets O
or O
financial O
resources O
and O
may O
lack O
management O
depth O
. O

The O
trading O
volume O
of O
securities O
of O
smaller O
capitalization O
companies O
is O
normally O
less O
than O
that O
of O
larger O
capitalization O
companies O
" " O
and O
therefore O
may O
disproportionately O
affect O
their O
market O
price O
" " O
tending O
to O
make O
them O
fall O
more O
in O
response O
to O
selling O
pressure O
than O
is O
the O
case O
with O
larger O
capitalization O
companies O
. O

These O
risks O
are O
enhanced O
for O
micro O
cap O
securities O
. O

Many O
micro O
cap O
companies O
tend O
to O
be O
new O
and O
have O
no O
proven O
track O
record O
. O

Some O
of O
these O
companies O
have O
no O
assets O
or O
operations O
" " O
while O
others O
have O
products O
and O
services O
that O
are O
still O
in O
development O
or O
have O
yet O
to O
be O
tested O
in O
the O
market O
. O

The O
prices O
of O
micro O
cap O
securities O
generally O
are O
even O
more O
volatile O
and O
their O
markets O
less O
liquid O
than O
other O
small O
or O
mid O
cap O
securities O
. O

Because O
micro O
cap O
stocks O
trade O
in O
low O
volumes O
" " O
any O
size O
of O
trade O
can O
have O
a O
large O
percentage O
impact O
on O
the O
price O
of O
the O
stock O
. O

REIT O
Risk O
: O
To O
the O
extent O
that O
the O
Fund O
invests O
in O
companies O
that O

in O
real O

" " O
such O
as O

" " O

Fund O
may O
be O

to O

associated O
with O
the O
real O
estate O
market O
as O
a O
whole O
" " O
such O
as O

" " O
regulations O
" " O
and O

and O

factors O
that O
negatively O
impact O
the O
real O

market O
" " O
and O
with O
direct O
ownership O
of O
real O

" " O
such O
as O
decreases O
in O
real O

" " O

" " O

and O
increases O
in O

costs O
" " O
interest O
rates O
and/or O
property O
taxes O
. O

Exchange O
Traded O
Fund O
Risk O
: O
An O
ETF O
may O
trade O
at O
a O
discount O
to O
its O
net O
asset O
value O
. O

the O
Fund O
invests O
in O
addition O
to O
the O
Fund O
s O
direct O
fees O
and O
expenses O
. O

The O
Fund O
will O
also O
incur O
brokerage O
costs O
when O
it O
purchases O
shares O
of O
ETFs O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
the O
Fund O
will O
be O
affected O
by O
losses O
of O
the O
underlying O
ETF O
and O
the O
level O
of O
risk O
arising O
from O
the O
investment O
practices O
of O
the O
underlying O
ETF O
. O

Inverse O
and O
leveraged O
ETFs O
use O
investment O
techniques O
and O
financial O
instruments O
that O
may O
be O
considered O
aggressive O
" " O
including O
the O
use O
of O
derivative O
transactions O
and O
short O
selling O
techniques O
. O

To O
the O
extent O
that O

Fund O

in O

that O

in O
commodities O
" " O
the O
demand O
and O

of O
these O

may O

widely O
. O

Commodity O
ETFs O
may O
use O
derivatives O
" " O
which O
exposes O
them O
to O
further O
risks O
" " O
including O

risk O
( O
i.e. O
" " O
the O
risk O
that O
the O
institution O
on O
the O
other O
side O
of O
the O
trade O
will O
default O
) O
. O

Exchange O
Traded O
Note O
Risk O
: O
ETNs O
are O
synthetic O
securities O
" " O
typically O
unsecured O
" " O
with O
returns O
linked O
to O
the O
performance O
of O
a O
market O
index O
. O

An O
ETN O
does O
not O
own O
the O
underlying O
index O
it O
is O
tracking O
" " O
and O
thus O
the O
Fund O
will O
have O
no O
claim O
on O
the O
index O
and O
will O
be O
totally O
reliant O
on O
the O
counterparty O
for O
payment O
. O

ETNs O
are O
subject O
to O
credit O
risk O
of O
the O
counterparty O
" " O
and O
the O
value O
of O
an O
ETN O
will O
vary O
and O
will O
be O
influenced O
by O
time O
to O
maturity O
" " O
level O
of O
supply O
and O
demand O
for O
the O
ETN O
" " O
volatility O
and O
lack O
of O
liquidity O
in O
underlying O
markets O
to O
which O
its O
payments O
are O
linked O
" " O
changes O
in O
the O
applicable O
interest O
rates O
" " O
changes O
in O
the O
issuer O
s O
credit O
rating O
" " O
and O
economic O
" " O
legal O
" " O
political O
" " O
or O
geographic O
events O
. O

The O
Fund O
will O
bear O
its O
proportionate O
share O
of O
any O
fees O
and O
expenses O
borne O
by O
the O
ETN O
. O

Sector O
Risk O
: O
Equity O
securities O
within O
the O
same O
group O
of O
industries O
may O
decline O
in O
price O
due O
to O
sector-specific O
market O
or O
economic O
developments O
. O

If O
the O
Adviser O
invests O
a O
significant O
portion O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
assets O
in O
a O
particular O
sector O
" " O
the O
Fund O
is O
subject O
to O
the O
risk O
that O
companies O
in O
the O
same O
sector O
are O
likely O
to O
react O
similarly O
to O
legislative O
or O
regulatory O
changes O
" " O
adverse O
market O
conditions O
and/or O
increased O
competition O
affecting O
that O
market O
segment O
. O

This O
may O
cause O
the O
Fund O
s O
net O
asset O

to O

more O
than O
that O
of O

that O

. O

High O
Yield O
Securities O
Risk O
: O
The O
Fund O
may O
be O
subject O
to O
greater O
levels O
of O
price O
volatility O
as O

result O
of O

in O

securities O
and O
unrated O
securities O
of O
similar O
credit O
quality O
( O
commonly O
known O
as O

) O
than O
funds O
that O
do O
not O
invest O
in O
such O
securities O
. O

Such O
bonds O
are O
considered O
to O
be O
predominately O
speculative O
because O
of O
the O
issuer O
s O
lower O
ability O
to O
make O
principal O
and O
interest O
payments O
. O

An O
economic O
downturn O
" " O
a O
period O
of O
rising O
interest O
rates O
or O
increased O
price O
volatility O
could O
adversely O
affect O
the O
market O
for O
these O
securities O
" " O
and O
reduce O
the O
number O
of O
buyers O
should O
the O
Fund O
need O
to O
sell O
these O
securities O
( O
liquidity O
risk O
) O
. O

Should O
an O
issuer O
declare O
bankruptcy O
" " O
there O
may O
be O
potential O
for O
partial O
recovery O
of O
the O
value O
of O
the O
bonds O
" " O
but O
the O
Fund O
could O
also O
lose O
its O
entire O
investment O
. O

Municipal O
Securities O
Risk O
: O
Municipal O
securities O
are O
subject O
to O
the O
risk O
that O
legislative O
changes O
and O
local O
and O
business O
developments O
may O
adversely O
affect O
the O
yield O
or O
value O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
investments O
in O
such O
securities O
. O

Changes O
or O
proposed O
changes O
in O
federal O
tax O
laws O
may O
also O
cause O
the O
prices O
of O
municipal O
securities O
to O
fall O
and O
adversely O
affect O
the O
Fund O
s O
investment O
. O

Foreign O
Investment O
Risk O
: O
Foreign O
investing O
involves O
risks O
not O
typically O
associated O
with O
U.S. I-LOC
. O

These O
risks O
include O
" " O
among O
others O
" " O
adverse O
fluctuations O
in O
foreign O
currency O
values O
as O
well O
as O
adverse O
political O
" " O
social O
and O
economic O
developments O
affecting O
a O
foreign O
country O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
foreign O
investing O
involves O
less O
publicly O
available O
information O
" " O
and O
more O
volatile O
or O
less O
liquid O
securities O
markets O
. O

Foreign O
accounting O
may O
be O
less O
transparent O
than O
U.S. I-LOC
accounting O
practices O
and O
foreign O
regulation O
may O
be O
inadequate O
or O
irregular O
. O

Owning O
foreign O
securities O
could O
cause O
the O
Fund O
s O
performance O
to O
fluctuate O
more O
than O
if O
it O
held O
only O
U.S. I-LOC

Sovereign O
and O
Supranational O
Debt O
Risk O
: O
The O
Fund O
may O
invest O
in O
sovereign O
and O
supranational O
debt O
obligations O
. O

Investment O
in O
sovereign O
and O
supranational O
debt O
obligations O
involves O
special O
risks O
not O
present O
in O
foreign O
corporate O
debt O
obligations O
. O

The O
issuer O
of O
the O
debt O
or O
the O
governmental O
authorities O
that O
control O
the O
repayment O
of O
the O
debt O
may O
be O
unable O
or O
unwilling O
to O
repay O
principal O
or O
interest O
when O
due O
" " O
and O
the O
Fund O
may O
have O
limited O
recourse O
in O
the O
event O
of O
a O
default O
. O

During O
periods O
of O
economic O
uncertainty O
" " O
the O
market O
prices O
of O
sovereign O
and O
supranational O
debt O
" " O
and O
the O
Fund O
s O
net O
asset O
value O
" " O
may O
be O
more O
volatile O
than O
prices O
of O
U.S. I-LOC
. O

Non-Diversification O
Risk O
: O
As O
a O
non-diversified O
fund O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
invest O
more O
of O
its O
total O
assets O
in O
the O
securities O
of O
issuers O
that O
each O
represent O
greater O
than O
5 O
% O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
total O
assets O
. O

Because O
a O
relatively O
high O
percentage O
of O
the O
assets O
of O
the O
Fund O
may O
be O
invested O
in O
the O
securities O
of O
a O
limited O
number O
of O
issuers O
" " O
the O
value O
of O
shares O
of O
the O
Fund O
may O
be O
more O
sensitive O
to O
any O
single O
economic O
" " O
business O
" " O
political O
or O
regulatory O
occurrence O
than O
the O
value O
of O
shares O
of O
a O
diversified O
investment O
company O
. O

This O
fluctuation O
" " O
if O
significant O
" " O
may O
affect O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
Fund O
. O

Portfolio O
Turnover O
Risk O
: O
The O
Fund O
will O
likely O
have O
a O
high O
portfolio O
turnover O
rate O
. O

A O
high O
portfolio O
turnover O
rate O
can O
result O
in O
increased O
brokerage O
commission O
costs O
and O
may O
expose O
taxable O
shareholders O
to O
potentially O
larger O
current O
tax O
liability O
. O

Industry O
practice O
is O
to O
calculate O
the O
turnover O
ratio O
only O
on O
the O
Fund O
s O
long O
portfolio O
. O

If O
short O
positions O
were O
also O
included O
in O
this O
calculation O
" " O
the O
Fund O
s O
turnover O
ratio O
would O
likely O
be O
higher O
. O

PERFORMANCE O
Performance O
information O
is O
not O
included O
because O
the O
Fund O
had O
not O
yet O
commenced O
operations O
as O
of O
December O
31 O
" " O
2010 O
. O

" " O

and O

. O

Class O
B O

to O
Class O
A O

The O
fund O
pays O
transaction O
costs O
" " O
such O
as O
commissions O
" " O
when O
it O
buys O
and O

securities O
( O
or O
`` O
turns O
over O
'' O
its O
portfolio O
) O
. O

A O
higher O
portfolio O
turnover O
may O
indicate O
higher O
transaction O
costs O
and O
may O
mean O
higher O
taxes O
if O
you O
are O

in O

account O
. O

These O
costs O
are O
not O
reflected O
in O
annual O
fund O
operating O
expenses O
or O
in O
the O
expense O
example O
" " O
and O
can O
affect O
the O
fund O
's O
performance O
. O

Portfolio O
turnover O
rate O
for O
fiscal O
year O
2010 O
: O
186 O
% O
. O

Under O
normal O
circumstances O
" " O
the O
fund O
invests O
at O
least O
80 O
% O
of O
net O
assets O
" " O
plus O
the O
amount O
of O
any O
borrowings O
for O
investment O
purposes O
" " O
in O
securities O
backed O
by O
the O
full O
faith O
and O
credit O
of O
the O
US O
government O
" " O
including O
related O
repurchase O
agreements O
( O
the O
`` O
80 O
% O
test O
'' O
) O
. O

Within O
the O
80 O
% O
test O
" " O
the O
fund O
invests O
principally O
in O
Ginnie I-GOVERNMENT
Maes I-GOVERNMENT
( O
mortgage-backed O
securities O
issued O
or O
guaranteed O
by O
the O
Government I-GOVERNMENT
National I-GOVERNMENT
Mortgage I-GOVERNMENT
Association I-GOVERNMENT
( O
GNMA I-GOVERNMENT
) O
) O
" " O

but O
may O
also O
invest O
in O
US I-GOVERNMENT
Treasuries I-GOVERNMENT
and O
other O
securities O
that O
are O
backed O
by O
the O
full O
faith O
and O
credit O
of O
the O
US I-LOC
government O
. O

Outside O
the O
80 O
% O
test O
" " O
the O
fund O
may O
also O
invest O
in O
other O
debt O
and O
mortgage-backed O
securities O
" " O
including O
securities O
that O
are O
issued O
by O
US I-LOC
government O
agencies O
or O
instrumentalities O
but O
are O
not O
backed O
by O
the O
full O
faith O
and O
credit O
of O
the O
US I-LOC
government O
. O

In O
deciding O
which O
types O
of O
government O
bonds O
to O
buy O
and O
sell O
" " O
portfolio O
management O
first O
considers O
the O
relative O
attractiveness O
of O
US I-GOVERNMENT
Treasuries I-GOVERNMENT
compared O
to O
other O
US I-LOC
government O
and O
agency O
securities O
and O
then O
determines O
allocations O
. O

Their O
decisions O
are O
generally O
based O
on O
a O
number O
of O
factors O
" " O
including O
changes O
in O
supply O
and O
demand O
within O
the O
bond O
market O
. O

In O
choosing O
individual O
bonds O
" " O
portfolio O
management O
reviews O
each O
bond O
's O
fundamentals O
" " O
compares O
the O
yields O
of O
shorter O
maturity O
bonds O
to O
those O
of O
longer O
maturity O
bonds O
and O
uses O
technical O
analysis O
to O
project O
prepayment O
rates O
and O
other O
factors O
that O
could O
affect O
a O
bond O
's O
attractiveness O
. O

Portfolio O
management O
may O
also O
adjust O
the O
duration O
( O
a O
measure O
of O
sensitivity O
to O
interest O
rate O
movements O
) O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
portfolio O
" " O
based O
upon O
their O
analysis O
. O

GLOBAL O
TACTICAL O
ASSET O
ALLOCATION O
OVERLAY O
STRATEGY O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
the O
fund O
's O
policy O
of O
investing O
at O
least O
80 O
% O
of O
its O
assets O
in O
securities O
backed O
by O
the O
full O
faith O
and O
credit O
of O
the O
US I-LOC
government O
" " O
portfolio O
management O
seeks O
to O
enhance O
returns O
by O
employing O
a O
global O
tactical O
asset O
allocation O
( O
GTAA O
) O
overlay O
strategy O
. O

This O
strategy O
attempts O
to O
take O
advantage O
of O
inefficiencies O
within O
global O
bond O
and O
currency O
markets O
. O

The O
strategy O
is O
implemented O
through O
the O
use O
of O
derivatives O
" " O
which O
are O
contracts O
or O
other O
instruments O
whose O
value O
is O
based O
on O
" " O
for O
example O
" " O
indices O
" " O
currencies O
or O
securities O
. O

The O
strategy O
primarily O
uses O
exchange-traded O
futures O
contracts O
and O
over-the-counter O
forward O
currency O
contracts O
. O

Outside O
of O
the O
GTAA O
strategy O
" " O
portfolio O
management O
generally O
may O
use O
futures O
contracts O
" " O
interest O
rate O
swaps O
" " O
total O
return O
swaps O
and O
options O
on O
interest O
rate O
swaps O
" " O
and O
futures O
contracts O
" " O
which O
are O
types O
of O
derivatives O
( O
a O
contract O
whose O
value O
is O
based O
on O
" " O
for O
example O
" " O
indices O
" " O
currencies O
or O
securities O
) O
" " O
for O
duration O
management O
( O
i.e. O
" " O
reducing O
or O
increasing O
the O
sensitivity O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
portfolio O
to O
interest O
rate O
changes O
) O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
portfolio O
management O
generally O
may O
use O
options O
on O
US I-LOC
government O
agency O
mortgage-backed O
to-be-announced O
securities O
to O
enhance O
potential O
gain O
. O

The O
fund O
may O
also O
use O
various O
types O
of O
derivatives O
( O
i O
) O
for O
hedging O
purposes O
; O
( O
ii O
) O
for O
risk O
management O
; O
( O
iii O
) O
for O
non-hedging O
purposes O
to O
seek O
to O
enhance O
potential O
gains O
; O
or O
( O
iv O
) O
as O
a O
substitute O
for O
direct O
investment O
in O
a O
particular O
asset O
class O
or O
to O
keep O
cash O
on O
hand O
to O
meet O
shareholder O
redemptions O
. O

The O
fund O
may O
lend O
securities O
( O
up O
to O
one-third O
of O
total O
assets O
) O
to O
approved O
institutions O
. O

There O
are O
several O
risk O
factors O
that O
could O
hurt O
the O
fund O
's O
performance O
" " O
cause O
you O
to O
lose O
money O
or O
cause O
the O
fund O
's O
performance O
to O
trail O
that O
of O
other O
investments O
. O

The O
fund O
may O
not O
achieve O
its O
investment O
objective O
" " O
and O
is O
not O
intended O
to O
be O
a O
complete O
investment O
program O
. O

An O
investment O
in O
the O
fund O
is O
not O
a O
deposit O
of O
a O
bank O
and O
is O
not O
insured O
or O
guaranteed O
by O
the O
Federal I-GOVERNMENT
Deposit I-GOVERNMENT
Insurance I-GOVERNMENT
Corporation I-GOVERNMENT
or O
any O
other O
governmental O
agency O
. O

INTEREST O
RATE O
RISK O
. O

When O
interest O
rates O
rise O
" " O
prices O
of O
debt O
securities O
generally O
decline O
. O

The O
longer O
the O
duration O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
debt O
securities O
" " O
the O
more O
sensitive O
it O
will O
be O
to O
interest O
rate O
changes O
. O

( O
As O
a O
general O
rule O
" " O
a O
1 O
% O
rise O
in O
interest O
rates O
means O
a O
1 O
% O
fall O
in O
value O
for O
every O
year O
of O
duration O
. O
) O

Risks O
associated O
with O
derivatives O
include O
the O
risk O
that O
the O
derivative O
is O
not O
well O
correlated O
with O
the O
security O
" " O
index O
or O
currency O
to O
which O
it O
relates O
; O
the O
risk O
that O
derivatives O
may O
result O
in O
losses O
or O
missed O
opportunities O
; O
the O
risk O
that O
the O
fund O
will O
be O
unable O
to O
sell O
the O
derivative O
because O
of O
an O
illiquid O
secondary O
market O
; O
the O
risk O
that O
a O
counterparty O
is O
unwilling O
or O
unable O
to O
meet O
its O
obligation O
; O
and O
the O
risk O
that O
the O
derivative O
transaction O
could O
expose O
the O
fund O
to O
the O
effects O
of O
leverage O
" " O
which O
could O
increase O
the O
fund O
's O
exposure O
to O
the O
market O
and O
magnify O
potential O
losses O
. O

The O
success O
of O
the O
GTAA O
strategy O
depends O
" " O
in O
part O
" " O
on O
portfolio O
management O
's O
ability O
to O
analyze O
the O
correlation O
between O
various O
global O
markets O
and O
asset O
classes O
. O

If O
portfolio O
management O
's O
correlation O
analysis O
proves O
to O
be O
incorrect O
" " O
losses O
to O
the O
fund O
may O
be O
significant O
and O
may O
substantially O
exceed O
the O
intended O
level O
of O
market O
exposure O
for O
the O
GTAA O
strategy O
. O

As O
part O
of O
the O
GTAA O
strategy O
" " O
the O
fund O
will O
be O
exposed O
to O
the O
risks O
of O
non-US I-MISC
currency O
markets O
" " O
and O
global O
bond O
markets O
. O

Foreign O
currency O
rates O
may O
fluctuate O
significantly O
over O
short O
periods O
of O
time O
for O
a O
number O
of O
reasons O
" " O
including O
changes O
in O
interest O
rates O
and O
economic O
or O
political O
developments O
in O
the O
US O
or O
abroad O
. O

Global O
bond O
markets O
may O
also O
fluctuate O
for O
the O
same O
or O
similar O
reasons O
. O

As O
a O
result O
" " O
the O
fund O
's O
exposure O
to O
foreign O
currencies O
and O
global O
bond O
markets O
could O
cause O
lower O
returns O
or O
even O
losses O
to O
the O
fund O
. O

Although O
portfolio O
management O
seeks O
to O
limit O
these O
risks O
through O
the O
aggregation O
of O
various O
long O
and O
short O
positions O
" " O
there O
can O
be O
no O
assurance O
that O
they O
will O
be O
able O
to O
do O
so O
. O

SECURITY O
SELECTION O
RISK O
. O

The O
securities O
in O
the O
fund O
's O
portfolio O
may O
decline O
in O
value O
. O

Portfolio O
management O
could O
be O
wrong O
in O
its O
analysis O
of O
industries O
" " O
companies O
" " O
economic O
trends O
" " O
the O
relative O
attractiveness O
of O
different O
securities O
or O
other O
matters O
. O

The O
fund O
's O
performance O
could O
be O
hurt O
if O
an O
issuer O
of O
a O
debt O
security O
suffers O
an O
adverse O
change O
in O
financial O
condition O
that O
results O
in O
a O
payment O
default O
" " O
security O
downgrade O
or O
inability O
to O
meet O
a O
financial O
obligation O
. O

A O
financial O
institution O
or O
other O
counterparty O
with O
whom O
the O
fund O
does O
business O
" " O
or O
that O
underwrites O
" " O
distributes O
or O
guarantees O
any O
investments O
or O
contracts O
that O
the O
fund O
owns O
or O
is O
otherwise O
exposed O
to O
" " O
may O
decline O
in O
financial O
health O
and O
become O
unable O
to O
honor O
its O
commitments O
. O

This O
could O
cause O
losses O
for O
the O
fund O
or O
could O
delay O
the O
return O
or O
delivery O
of O
collateral O
or O
other O
assets O
to O
the O
fund O
. O

In O
certain O
situations O
" " O
it O
may O
be O
difficult O
or O
impossible O
to O
sell O
an O
investment O
in O
an O
orderly O
fashion O
at O
an O
acceptable O
price O
. O

PREPAYMENT O
AND O
EXTENSION O
RISK O
. O

When O
interest O
rates O
fall O
" " O
issuers O
of O
high O
interest O
debt O
obligations O
may O
pay O
off O
the O
debts O
earlier O
than O
expected O
( O
prepayment O
risk O
) O
" " O
and O
the O
fund O
may O
have O
to O
reinvest O
the O
proceeds O
at O
lower O
yields O
. O

When O
interest O
rates O
rise O
" " O
issuers O
of O
lower O
interest O
debt O
obligations O
may O
pay O
off O
the O
debts O
later O
than O
expected O
( O
extension O
risk O
) O
" " O
thus O
keeping O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
tied O
up O
in O
lower O
interest O
debt O
obligations O
. O

Ultimately O
" " O
any O
unexpected O
behavior O
in O
interest O
rates O
could O
increase O
the O
volatility O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
share O
price O
and O
yield O
and O
could O
hurt O
fund O
performance O
. O

Prepayments O
could O
also O
create O
capital O
gains O
tax O
liability O
in O
some O
instances O
. O

If O
market O
conditions O
make O
it O
difficult O
to O
value O
some O
investments O
" " O
the O
fund O
may O
value O
these O
investments O
using O
more O
subjective O
methods O
" " O
such O
as O
fair O
value O
pricing O
. O

In O
such O
cases O
" " O
the O
value O
determined O
for O
an O
investment O
could O
be O
different O
than O
the O
value O
realized O
upon O
such O
investment O
's O
sale O
. O

As O
a O
result O
" " O
you O
could O
pay O
more O
than O
the O
market O
value O
when O
buying O
fund O
shares O
or O
receive O
less O
than O
the O
market O
value O
when O
selling O
fund O
shares O
. O

SECURITIES O
LENDING O
RISK O
. O

Any O
decline O
in O
the O
value O
of O
a O
portfolio O
security O
that O
occurs O
while O
the O
security O
is O
out O
on O
loan O
is O
borne O
by O
the O
fund O
" " O
and O
will O
adversely O
affect O
performance O
. O

Also O
" " O
there O
may O
be O
delays O
in O
recovery O
of O
securities O
loaned O
or O
even O
a O
loss O
of O
rights O
in O
the O
collateral O
should O
the O
borrower O
of O
the O
securities O
fail O
financially O
while O
holding O
the O
security O
. O

How O
a O
fund O
's O
returns O
vary O
from O
year O
to O
year O
can O
give O
an O
idea O
of O
its O
risk O
; O
so O
can O
comparing O
fund O
performance O
to O
overall O
market O
performance O
( O
as O
measured O
by O
an O
appropriate O
market O
index O
) O
. O

Past O
performance O
may O
not O
indicate O
future O
results O
. O

All O
performance O
figures O
below O
assume O
that O
dividends O
were O
reinvested O
. O

For O
more O
recent O
performance O
figures O
" " O

( O

not O
form O

Investment O
Objective O
The O
Fund O
s O
investment O
objective O
is O
total O
return O
. O

Total O
return O
is O
defined O
as O
income O
plus O
capital O
appreciation O
. O

The O
Fund O
primarily O
invests O
its O
assets O
in O
Global I-ORG
Macro I-ORG
Portfolio I-ORG
" " O
a O
separate O

company O
with O
the O

and O

as O
the O
Fund O
. O

Fees O
and O

of O
the O
Fund O

This O
Example O

Portfolio O
Turnover O

" " O

" " O

( O
or O
`` O

'' O
its O

) O
. O

rate O

and O

in O

25 O
% O
of O

Principal O
Investment O
Strategies O
The O

seeks O

and O

The O

( O

. O

sovereign O

" " O

both O

" " O

" " O
to O

" " O

. O

The O

or O

. O

Principal O
Risks O
Foreign O
Investment O
Risk O
. O

Because O
the O
Fund O
can O
invest O
a O
significant O
portion O
of O
its O
assets O
in O
foreign O
instruments O
" " O
the O
value O
of O
Fund O
shares O
can O
be O
adversely O
affected O
by O
changes O
in O
currency O
exchange O
rates O
and O
political O
and O
economic O
developments O
abroad O
. O

In O
emerging O
or O
less O
developed O
countries O
" " O
these O
risks O
can O
be O
more O
significant O
. O

Investment O
markets O
in O
emerging O
market O
countries O
are O
substantially O
smaller O
" " O
less O
liquid O
and O
more O
volatile O
than O
the O
major O
markets O
in O
developed O
countries O
" " O
and O
as O
a O
result O
" " O
Fund O
share O
values O
may O
be O
more O
volatile O
. O

Emerging O
market O
countries O
may O
have O
relatively O
unstable O
governments O
and O
economies O
. O

Emerging O
market O
investments O
often O
are O
subject O
to O
speculative O
trading O
" " O
which O
typically O
contributes O
to O
volatility O
. O

Trading O
in O
foreign O
and O
emerging O
markets O
typically O
involves O
higher O
expense O
than O
trading O
in O
the O
United I-LOC
States I-LOC
. O

The O
Fund O
may O
have O
difficulties O
enforcing O
its O
legal O
or O
contractual O
rights O
in O
a O
foreign O
country O
. O

Economic O
and O
other O
events O
( O
whether O
real O
or O
perceived O
) O
can O
reduce O
the O
demand O
for O
certain O
income O
securities O
" " O
or O
for O
investments O
generally O
" " O
which O
may O
reduce O
market O
prices O
and O
cause O
the O
value O
of O
Fund O
shares O
to O
fall O
. O

The O
frequency O
and O
magnitude O
of O
such O
changes O
can O
not O
be O
predicted O
. O

Certain O
income O
securities O
can O
experience O
downturns O
in O
trading O
activity O
and O
" " O
at O
such O
times O
" " O
the O
supply O
of O
such O
instruments O
in O
the O
market O
may O
exceed O
the O
demand O
. O

At O
other O
times O
" " O
the O
demand O
for O
such O
instruments O
may O
exceed O
the O
supply O
in O
the O
market O
. O

An O
imbalance O
in O
supply O
and O
demand O
in O
the O
market O
may O
result O
in O
valuation O
uncertainties O
and O
greater O
volatility O
" " O
less O
liquidity O
" " O
widening O
credit O
spreads O
and O
a O
lack O
of O
price O
transparency O
in O
the O
market O
. O

No O
active O
trading O
market O
may O
exist O
for O
certain O
investments O
" " O
which O
may O
impair O
the O
ability O
of O
the O
Fund O
to O
sell O
or O
to O
realize O
the O
full O
value O
of O

. O

of O

Risk I-MISC
of I-MISC

Rated I-MISC

. O

because O
of O

Interest O
Rate O
Risk O
. O

As O
interest O
rates O
rise O
" " O
the O
value O
of O
certain O
fixed O
income O
securities O
is O
likely O
to O
decline O
. O

Conversely O
" " O
when O
interest O
rates O
decline O
" " O
the O
value O
of O
such O
investments O
is O
likely O
to O
rise O
. O

Securities O
with O
longer O
durations O
are O
more O
sensitive O
to O
changes O
in O
interest O
rates O
than O
securities O
with O
shorter O
durations O
" " O
making O
them O
more O
volatile O
. O

A O
rising O
interest O
rate O
environment O
may O
extend O
the O
average O
life O
of O
mortgages O
or O
other O
asset-backed O
receivables O
underlying O
mortgage-backed O
or O
asset-backed O
securities O
. O

This O
extension O
increases O
the O
risk O
of O
depreciation O
due O
to O
future O
increases O
in O
market O
interest O
rates O
. O

In O
a O
declining O
interest O
rate O
environment O
" " O
prepayment O
of O
securities O
may O
increase O
. O

In O
such O
circumstances O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
have O
to O
re-invest O
the O
prepayment O
proceeds O
at O
lower O
yields O
. O

After-tax O
returns O
are O
calculated O
using O
the O
highest O
historical O
individual O
federal O
income O
tax O
rates O
and O
do O
not O
reflect O
the O

of O
state O
and O
local O
taxes O
. O

Actual O

returns O

on O
a O

tax O
situation O
and O
the O
actual O
characterization O
of O
distributions O
" " O
and O
may O
differ O
from O
those O
shown O
. O

After-tax O
returns O
are O
not O
relevant O
to O
shareholders O
who O
hold O
shares O
in O
tax-deferred O
accounts O
or O
to O
shares O
held O
by O
non-taxable O
entities O
. O

After-tax O
returns O
for O
other O

of O
shares O
will O
vary O
from O
the O

for O

shares O
. O

Taxes O
for O
that O
period O
because O
no O
taxable O
distributions O
were O
made O
during O
that O
period O
. O

" " O

to O

and O

Intermediaries O

. O

. O

Derivatives O
" " O
forward-settling O
securities O
" " O
and O
short O
sale O
transactions O
involve O
leverage O
because O
they O
can O
provide O
investment O
exposure O
in O
an O
amount O
exceeding O
the O
initial O
investment O
. O

Leverage O
can O
magnify O
investment O
risks O
and O
cause O
losses O
to O
be O
realized O
more O
quickly O
. O

A O
small O
change O
in O
the O
underlying O
asset O
" " O
instrument O
" " O
or O
index O
can O
lead O
to O
a O
significant O
loss O
. O

Assets O
segregated O
to O
cover O
these O
transactions O
may O
decline O
in O
value O
and O
are O
not O
available O
to O
meet O
redemptions O
. O

Forward-settling O
securities O
and O
short O
sale O
transactions O
also O
involve O
the O
risk O
that O
a O
security O
will O
not O
be O

" " O

" " O
available O
for O
purchase O
" " O
or O
paid O
for O
when O
anticipated O
. O

increase O
in O
the O
market O
price O
of O
securities O
sold O
short O
will O
result O
in O
a O
loss O
. O

Government O
legislation O
or O
regulation O
could O
affect O
the O
use O
of O
these O
transactions O
and O
could O
limit O
the O
fund O
's O
ability O
to O
pursue O
its O
investment O
strategies O
. O

Forward-settling O

Derivatives O
" " O
forward-settling O
securities O
" " O
and O
short O
sale O
transactions O
involve O
leverage O
because O
they O
can O
provide O
investment O
exposure O
in O
an O
amount O
exceeding O
the O
initial O
investment O
. O

Leverage O
can O
magnify O
investment O
risks O
and O
cause O
losses O
to O
be O
realized O
more O
quickly O
. O

A O
small O
change O
in O
the O
underlying O
asset O
" " O
instrument O
" " O
or O
index O
can O
lead O
to O
a O
significant O
loss O
. O

Assets O
segregated O
to O
cover O
these O
transactions O
may O
decline O
in O
value O
and O
are O
not O
available O
to O
meet O
redemptions O
. O

Forward-settling O
securities O
and O
short O
sale O
transactions O
also O
involve O
the O
risk O
that O
a O
security O
will O
not O
be O

" " O

for O
purchase O
" " O
or O

for O
when O
anticipated O
. O

of O
securities O

short O
will O
result O
in O
a O
loss O
. O

or O
regulation O

and O
could O

the O

to O

Effective O

" " O

FMRC I-ORG
invests O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
in O
securities O
issued O
anywhere O
in O
the O
world O
" " O
including O
the O
United I-LOC
States I-LOC
. O

FMRC I-ORG
generally O
allocates O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
between O
stocks O
( O
equity O
securities O
of O
all O
types O
" " O
including O
domestic O
" " O
international O
and O
emerging O
markets O
equities O
and O
ETFs O
) O
and O
bonds O
( O
fixed O
income O
securities O
of O
all O
types O
" " O
including O
domestic O
" " O
international O
" " O
emerging O
markets O
" " O
high O
yield O
" " O
investment O
grade O
and O
inflation O
protected O
bonds O
" " O
floating O
rate O
loans O
" " O
and O
ETNs O
) O
. O

The O
fund O
may O
make O
investments O
that O
do O
not O
fall O
into O
either O
asset O
class O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
may O
invest O
a O
significant O
portion O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
in O
non-traditional O
assets O
" " O
including O
commodity-related O
investments O
. O

The O
fund O
gains O
exposure O
to O
each O
asset O
class O
by O
investing O
primarily O
in O
a O
combination O
of O
Fidelity I-ORG
funds O
and O
unaffiliated O
ETFs O
( O
underlying O
funds O
) O
" " O
although O
it O
may O
also O
invest O
directly O
in O
individual O
securities O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
may O
invest O
up O
to O
25 O
% O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
in O
a O
wholly-owned O
subsidiary O
of O
the O
fund O
organized O
under O
the O
laws O
of O
the O
Cayman I-LOC
Islands I-LOC
( O
the O
Subsidiary O
) O
. O

The O
Subsidiary O
is O
managed O
by O
FMRC I-ORG
and O
has O
the O
same O
investment O
objective O
as O
the O
fund O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
intends O
to O
invest O
the O
Subsidiary O
's O
assets O
directly O
in O
commodity-related O
ETFs O
and O
ETNs O
and O
other O
commodities O
and O
commodity-linked O
investments O
. O

FMR I-ORG
normally O
allocates O
the O
fund O
's O
investments O
across O
different O
countries O
and O
regions O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
regularly O
reviews O
the O
fund O
's O
allocation O
and O
makes O
changes O
to O
favor O
investments O
it O
believes O
will O
provide O
the O
most O
favorable O
outlook O
for O
achieving O
the O
fund O
's O
objective O
. O

Depending O
on O
its O
outlook O
" " O
FMRC I-ORG
may O
from O
time O
to O
time O
allocate O
substantially O
all O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
in O
either O
the O
stock O
class O
or O
bond O
class O
. O

In O
making O
allocation O
decisions O
" " O
FMRC I-ORG
will O
consider O
multiple O
data O
sources O
" " O
including O
economic O
research O
" " O
quantitative O
analysis O
" " O
fundamental O
research O
" " O
and O
technical O
analysis O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
expects O
to O
emphasize O
specific O
themes O
within O
each O
asset O
class O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
may O
actively O
adjust O
the O
fund O
's O
allocation O
between O
asset O
classes O
at O
any O
time O
to O
take O
advantage O
of O
short-term O
market O
opportunities O
" " O
and O
may O
therefore O
hold O
some O
positions O
for O
a O
relatively O
short O
period O
of O
time O
. O

Other O
allocation O
decisions O
will O
be O
strategic O
and O
longer-term O
in O
nature O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
will O
attempt O
to O
capture O
short-term O
market O
opportunities O
by O
actively O
trading O
ETFs O
" " O
but O
does O
not O
intend O
to O
actively O
trade O
Fidelity I-ORG
funds O
. O

For O
current O
information O
on O
fund O
holdings O
" " O
please O
visit O
Fidelity I-ORG
's O

FMRC I-ORG
invests O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
in O
securities O
issued O
anywhere O
in O
the O
world O
" " O
including O
the O
United I-LOC
States I-LOC
. O

FMRC I-ORG
generally O
allocates O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
between O
stocks O
( O
equity O
securities O
of O
all O
types O
" " O
including O
domestic O
" " O
international O
and O
emerging O
markets O
equities O
and O
ETFs O
) O
and O
bonds O
( O
fixed O
income O
securities O
of O
all O
types O
" " O
including O
domestic O
" " O
international O
" " O
emerging O
markets O
" " O
high O
yield O
" " O
investment O
grade O
and O
inflation O
protected O
bonds O
" " O
floating O
rate O
loans O
" " O
and O
ETNs O
) O
. O

The O
fund O
may O
make O
investments O
that O
do O
not O
fall O
into O
either O
asset O
class O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
may O
invest O
a O
significant O
portion O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
in O
non-traditional O
assets O
" " O
including O
commodity-related O
investments O
. O

The O
fund O
gains O
exposure O
to O
each O
asset O
class O
by O
investing O
primarily O
in O
a O
combination O
of O
Fidelity I-ORG
funds O
and O
unaffiliated O
ETFs O
( O
underlying O
funds O
) O
" " O
although O
it O
may O
also O
invest O
directly O
in O
individual O
securities O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
may O
invest O
up O
to O
25 O
% O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
in O
a O
wholly-owned O
subsidiary O
of O
the O
fund O
organized O
under O
the O
laws O
of O
the O
Cayman I-LOC
Islands I-LOC
( O
the O
Subsidiary O
) O
. O

The O
Subsidiary O
is O
managed O
by O
FMRC I-ORG
and O
has O
the O
same O
investment O
objective O
as O
the O
fund O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
intends O
to O
invest O
the O
Subsidiary O
's O
assets O
directly O
in O
commodity-related O
ETFs O
and O
ETNs O
and O
other O
commodities O
and O
commodity-linked O
investments O
. O

FMR I-ORG
normally O
allocates O
the O
fund O
's O
investments O
across O
different O
countries O
and O
regions O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
regularly O
reviews O
the O
fund O
's O
allocation O
and O
makes O
changes O
to O
favor O
investments O
it O
believes O
will O
provide O
the O
most O
favorable O
outlook O
for O
achieving O
the O
fund O
's O
objective O
. O

Depending O
on O
its O
outlook O
" " O
FMRC I-ORG
may O
from O
time O
to O
time O
allocate O
substantially O
all O
of O
the O
fund O
's O
assets O
in O
either O
the O
stock O
class O
or O
bond O
class O
. O

In O
making O
allocation O
decisions O
" " O
FMRC I-ORG
will O
consider O
multiple O
data O
sources O
" " O
including O
economic O
research O
" " O
quantitative O
analysis O
" " O
fundamental O
research O
" " O
and O
technical O
analysis O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
expects O
to O
emphasize O
specific O
themes O
within O
each O
asset O
class O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
may O
actively O
adjust O
the O
fund O
's O
allocation O
between O
asset O
classes O
at O
any O
time O
to O
take O
advantage O
of O
short-term O
market O
opportunities O
" " O
and O
may O
therefore O
hold O
some O
positions O
for O
a O
relatively O
short O
period O
of O
time O
. O

Other O
allocation O
decisions O
will O
be O
strategic O
and O
longer-term O
in O
nature O
. O

FMRC I-ORG
will O
attempt O
to O
capture O
short-term O
market O
opportunities O
by O
actively O
trading O
ETFs O
" " O
but O
does O
not O
intend O
to O
actively O
trade O
Fidelity I-ORG
funds O
. O

For O
current O
information O
on O
fund O
holdings O
" " O

Fidelity I-ORG
's O
website O

. O

information O
on O

funds O
" " O

. O

of O

" " O

the O

site O
of O
the O
company O

or O

. O

The O
non-traditional O
assets O
in O
which O
the O
fund O
invests O
may O
include O
commodities O

investments O
" " O
real O

" " O
and O

strategies O
" " O
which O
can O
be O
less O

with O

overall O
stock O
market O
than O

classes O
. O

In O

to O
the O

discussed O
above O
" " O
FMRC I-ORG
may O
also O

's O

to O
broker O
dealers O
or O
other O
institutions O
to O

. O

FMRC I-ORG
may O
also O
use O
various O
techniques O
" " O
such O
as O
buying O
and O
selling O
futures O
contracts O
" " O
as O
tools O
in O
the O

of O

. O

If O
FMRC I-ORG
's O
strategies O
do O
not O
work O
as O
intended O
" " O
the O
fund O
may O
not O

objective O
. O

: O

" " O

" " O

Our O

business O
. O

We O
believe O

. O

that O

" " O

We O

. O

to O

EFH I-ORG

" " O

to O
more O
than O
2 O

" " O

" " O

" " O

“ O

“ O

" " O

" " O
” O

“ O

" " O
just O

week O
we O
announced O

of O
orphan O
drug O

for O
INNO-206 I-MISC
in O

and O

to O

for O
this O
deadliest O
of O

. O

" " O

SEC I-GOVERNMENT
Comment O
: O
In O
the O
section O
entitled O
Fund I-MISC
Summaries-Principal I-MISC
Risks I-MISC
in O
the O
Prospectus O
" " O
the O
last O
bullet O
point O
states O
that O
: O
The O
Fund O
may O
invest O
a O
significant O
portion O
of O
its O
assets O
in O
companies O
within O
the O
financial O
services O
and O
consumer O
discretionary O
sectors O
. O

bullet O
point O
does O
not O
convey O
a O
risk O
. O

Please O
revise O
to O
make O
it O
a O
risk O
and O
revise O
the O
Fund O

principal O
strategy O
as O

. O

Response O
: O
The O
Fund O
at O

has O
been O
overweight O
in O

sectors O
( O
financial O
services O
and O
consumer O

sectors O

to O

investments O
are O
not O
considered O
by O

to O
be O

strategies O
. O

believes O
that O
the O

investment O

as O

in O
the O
Prospectus O
accurately O
reflect O
the O
strategies O
for O
the O

. O

" " O

in O

that O

a O

to O

Fund O
. O

Therefore O
" " O

Fund O
has O
added O
a O
principal O
risk O
to O
reflect O
this O
matter O
. O

The O
principal O
risk O
will O
be O
revised O
to O
read O
as O
follows O
: O
The O
Fund O
often O
invests O
a O
significant O
portion O
of O
its O
assets O
in O
companies O
within O
the O
financial O
services O
and O
consumer O
discretionary O
sectors O
" " O
and O
its O

if O

the O
overall O
stock O

. O

SEC I-GOVERNMENT
Comment O
: O

" " O

point O
states O
that O
: O
The O

may O

of O

" " O

and O

. O

investments O
. O

: O

Fund O

strategy O

of O

securities O

and O
developed O
over-the-counter O
markets O
" " O
or O
through O
American I-MISC
Depositary I-MISC
Receipts I-MISC
( O
ADR I-MISC
) O
or O
Global I-MISC
Depositary I-MISC
Receipts I-MISC
( O
GDR I-MISC
) O
covering O
such O
securities O
. O

The O
Fund O
expects O
to O
invest O
in O
foreign O
securities O
mainly O
through O
ADRs I-MISC
or O
GDRs I-MISC
. O

Therefore O
" " O
the O
Registrant O
believes O
that O
the O
disclosure O
does O
not O

to O
be O
amended O
. O

If O
this O
practice O
were O
to O
change O
" " O
the O

will O

. O

the O
second O
sentence O
of O
the O

paragraph O
states O
that O
: O

believe O

valued O

is O

no O

a O
discount O
to O
our O
private O
market O
value O

. O

please O

as O

for O

revise O
the O

: O

that O

will O
exercise O
its O
right O
to O
terminate O
a O
securities O

preserve O
its O
right O
to O

upon O

holders O
of O
the O
securities O
. O

As O
such O
" " O

of O

Trust O
has O
the O

to O
recall O
securities O
if O
a O

matter O

to O
occur O
. O

of O
Portfolio O
Securities O

loss O
. O

It O
states O
that O
: O

may O
be O

to O

and O

to O

. O

As O

" " O

in O

in O

. O

" " O

to O

About O
Cushing I-MISC
s I-MISC
Syndrome I-MISC
Endogenous O
Cushing I-MISC
s I-MISC
Syndrome I-MISC
is O
caused O
by O
prolonged O
exposure O
of O
the O
body O
s O
tissues O
to O
high O
levels O
of O
the O
hormone O
cortisol O
due O
to O
a O
variety O
of O
pathologic O
conditions O
. O

Cushing I-MISC
s I-MISC
Syndrome I-MISC
is O
an O
orphan O
indication O
which O
most O
commonly O
affects O
adults O
aged O
20 O
to O
50 O
. O

An O
estimated O
10 O
to O
15 O
of O
every O
one O
million O
people O
are O
newly O
diagnosed O
with O
this O
syndrome O
each O
year O
" " O
resulting O
in O
over O
"3,000" O
new O
patients O
in O
the O
US I-LOC
. O

An O
estimated O
"20,000" O
patients O
in O
the O
US I-LOC
have O
Cushing I-MISC
s I-MISC
Syndrome I-MISC
. O

Symptoms O
vary O
" " O
but O
most O
people O
have O
one O
or O
more O
of O
the O
following O
manifestations O
: O
high O
blood O
sugar O
" " O
diabetes O
" " O
high O
blood O
pressure O
" " O
upper O
body O
obesity O
" " O
rounded O
face O
" " O
increased O
fat O
around O
the O
neck O
" " O
thinning O
arms O
and O
legs O
" " O
severe O
fatigue O
and O
weak O
muscles O
. O

Irritability O
" " O
anxiety O
" " O
cognitive O
disturbances O
and O
depression O
are O
common O
. O

Cushing I-MISC
s I-MISC
Syndrome I-MISC
can O
affect O
every O
organ O
system O
in O
the O
body O
and O
can O
be O
lethal O
if O
not O
treated O
effectively O
. O

There O
is O
no O
FDA-approved I-MISC
treatment O
for O
Cushing I-MISC
s I-MISC
Syndrome I-MISC
. O

About O
Psychotic O
Depression O
Psychotic O
depression O
is O
a O
serious O
psychiatric O
disorder O
that O
affects O
approximately O
three O
million O
people O
annually O
in O
the O
United I-LOC
States I-LOC
. O

It O
is O
more O
prevalent O
than O
either O
schizophrenia I-MISC
or O
bipolar I-MISC
I I-MISC
disorder I-MISC
. O

The O
disorder O
is O
characterized O
by O
severe O
depression O
accompanied O
by O
delusions O
" " O
hallucinations O
or O
both O
. O

People O
with O
psychotic O
depression O
are O
approximately O
70 O
times O
more O
likely O
to O
commit O
suicide O
than O
the O
general O
population O
and O
often O
require O
lengthy O
and O
expensive O
hospital O
stays O
. O

There O
is O
no O
FDA-approved I-MISC
treatment O
for O
psychotic O
depression O
. O

About O
Weight O
Gain O
Caused O
by O
Antipsychotics O
The O
group O
of O
medications O
known O
as O
atypical O
antipsychotics O
" " O
including O
olanzapine I-MISC
" " O
risperidone I-MISC
" " O
clozapine I-MISC
and O
quetiapine I-MISC
" " O
are O
widely O
used O
to O
treat O
schizophrenia I-MISC
and O
bipolar I-MISC
disorder I-MISC
. O

All O
medications O
in O
this O
group O
are O
associated O
with O
treatment O
emergent O
weight O
gain O
of O
varying O
degrees O
and O
carry O
warning O
labels O
relating O
to O
treatment O
emergent O
hyperglycemia I-MISC
and O
diabetes I-MISC
mellitus I-MISC
. O

Weight O
gain O
and O
alterations O
in O
metabolic O
efficiency O
have O
been O
observed O
for O
many O
years O
in O
patients O
with O
abnormally O
high O
circulating O
cortisol O
. O

There O
is O
no O
FDA-approved I-MISC
treatment O
for O
the O
weight O
gain O
associated O
with O
the O
use O
of O
antipsychotic O
medications O
. O

About O
CORLUX I-MISC
Corcept I-ORG
s O
first-generation O
compound O
" " O
CORLUX I-MISC
" " O
also O
known O
as O
mifepristone I-MISC
" " O
directly O
blocks O
the O
GR-II I-MISC
( O
cortisol O
) O
receptor O
and O
the O
progesterone O
receptor O
. O

Intellectual O
property O
protection O
is O
in O
place O
to O
protect O
important O
methods O
of O
use O
for O
CORLUX I-MISC
. O

Corcept I-ORG
retains O
worldwide O
rights O
to O
its O

property O
related O
to O
CORLUX I-MISC
. O

About O
CORT I-MISC
108297 I-MISC
CORT B-MISC
108297 I-MISC
is O
one O
of O
several O
potent O
" " O
selective O
antagonists O
of O
the O
GR-II I-MISC
receptor I-MISC
that O
we O
have O
discovered O
and O
for O
which O
Corcept I-ORG
owns O
worldwide O
intellectual O
property O
rights O
. O

In O
in O
vitro O
binding O
affinity O
and O
functional O
assays O
it O
does O
not O
have O
affinity O
for O
the O
PR I-MISC
( O
progesterone I-MISC
) O
" " O
ER I-MISC
( O
estrogen I-MISC
) O
" " O
AR I-MISC
( O
androgen I-MISC
) O
or O
GR-I I-MISC
( O
mineralocorticoid I-MISC
) O
receptors O
. O

About O
Corcept I-ORG
Therapeutics I-ORG
Incorporated I-ORG
Corcept B-ORG
is O
a O
pharmaceutical O
company O
engaged O
in O
the O
discovery O
and O
development O
of O
drugs O
for O
the O
treatment O
of O
severe O
metabolic O
and O
psychiatric O
disorders O
. O

The O
company O
has O
two O
Phase O
3 O
programs O
ongoing O
; O
CORLUX I-ORG

67 O

: O

. O

" " O
there O

not O

The O

" " O

Many O

s O

. O

in O

markets O
has O
led O

States I-GOVERNMENT

Federal I-GOVERNMENT
" " O

" " O

" " O

The O
fund O
s O
main O

factors O
are O
listed O
below O
in O

order O
. O

Before O
investing O
" " O

to O

Active O
management O
risk O
The O
subadviser O
s O
investment O
strategy O
may O
fail O
to O
produce O
the O
intended O
result O
. O

Equity O
securities O
risk O
The O
value O
of O
a O
company O
s O
equity O
securities O
is O
subject O
to O
changes O
in O
the O
company O
s O
financial O
condition O
" " O
and O
overall O
market O
and O
economic O
conditions O
. O

The O
securities O
of O
value O
companies O
are O
subject O
to O
the O
risk O
that O
the O
companies O
may O
not O
overcome O
the O
adverse O
business O
developments O
or O
other O
factors O
causing O
their O
securities O
to O
be O
underpriced O
or O
that O
the O
market O
may O
never O
come O
to O
recognize O
their O
fundamental O
value O
. O

Fixed-income O
securities O
risk O
Fixed-income O
securities O
are O
affected O
by O
changes O
in O
interest O
rates O
and O
credit O
quality O
. O

A O
rise O
in O
interest O
rates O
typically O
causes O
bond O
prices O
to O
fall O
. O

The O
longer O
the O
average O
maturity O
of O
the O
bonds O
held O
by O
the O
fund O
" " O
the O
more O
sensitive O
the O
fund O
is O
likely O
to O
be O
to O
interest-rate O
changes O
. O

There O
is O
the O
possibility O
that O
the O
issuer O
of O
the O
security O
will O
not O
repay O
all O
or O
a O
portion O
of O
the O
principal O
borrowed O
and O
will O
not O
make O
all O
interest O
payments O
. O

Lower-rated O
fixed-income O
securities O
and O
high-yield O
securities O
involve O
a O
higher O
degree O
of O
risk O
than O
fixed-income O
securities O
in O
higher-rated O
categories O
. O

Foreign O
securities O
risk O
As O

to O

companies O
" " O

. O

. O

and O

. O

Calendar O
year O
total O
returns O

do O

. O

Management O
is O
responsible O
for O
establishing O
and O
maintaining O
adequate O
internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
. O

Internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
is O
a O
process O
to O
provide O
reasonable O
assurance O
regarding O
the O
reliability O
of O
the O
Company O
s O
financial O
reporting O
for O
external O
purposes O
in O
accordance O
with O
accounting I-LEGISLATION/ACT
principles I-LEGISLATION/ACT
generally I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accepted I-LEGISLATION/ACT
in O
the O
United I-LOC
States I-LOC
of I-LOC
America I-LOC
. O

Because O
of O
its O
inherent O
limitations O
" " O
internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
may O
not O
prevent O
or O
detect O
misstatements O
. O

Also O
" " O
projections O
of O
any O
evaluation O
of O
effectiveness O
to O
future O
periods O
are O
subject O
to O
the O
risk O
that O
controls O
may O
become O
inadequate O
because O
of O
changes O
in O
conditions O
" " O
or O
that O
the O
degree O
of O
compliance O
with O
the O
policies O
and O
procedures O
may O
deteriorate O
. O

Management O
conducted O
an O
assessment O
of O
the O
Company O
s O
internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
based O
on O
the O
criteria O
established O
by O

of I-ORG

Organizations I-ORG
of I-ORG

Framework I-LEGISLATION/ACT
. O

" " O
as O

" " O

assessed O
risk O
. O

Our O
audits O
also O
included O
performing O
such O
other O
procedures O
as O
we O
considered O
necessary O
in O
the O
circumstances O
. O

We O
believe O
that O
our O
audits O
provide O
a O
reasonable O
basis O
for O
our O
opinions O
. O

A O
company O
s O
internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
is O
a O
process O
designed O
to O
provide O
reasonable O
assurance O
regarding O
the O
reliability O
of O
financial O
reporting O
and O
the O
preparation O
of O
financial O
statements O
for O
external O
purposes O
in O
accordance O
with O
generally I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accepted I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accounting I-LEGISLATION/ACT
principles I-LEGISLATION/ACT
. O

A O
company O
s O
internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
includes O
those O
policies O
and O
procedures O
that O
( O
i O
) O
pertain O
to O
the O
maintenance O
of O
records O
that O
" " O
in O
reasonable O
detail O
" " O
accurately O
and O
fairly O
reflect O
the O
transactions O
and O
dispositions O
of O
the O
assets O
of O
the O
company O
; O
( O
ii O
) O
provide O
reasonable O
assurance O
that O
transactions O
are O
recorded O
as O
necessary O
to O
permit O
preparation O
of O
financial O
statements O
in O
accordance O
with O
generally I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accepted I-LEGISLATION/ACT
accounting I-LEGISLATION/ACT
principles I-LEGISLATION/ACT
" " O
and O
that O
receipts O
and O
expenditures O
of O
the O
company O
are O
being O
made O
only O
in O
accordance O
with O
authorizations O
of O
management O
and O
directors O
of O
the O
company O
; O
and O
( O
iii O
) O
provide O
reasonable O
assurance O
regarding O
prevention O
or O
timely O
detection O
of O
unauthorized O
acquisition O
" " O
use O
" " O
or O
disposition O
of O
the O
company O
s O
assets O
that O
could O
have O
a O
material O
effect O
on O
the O
financial O
statements O
. O

Because O
of O
its O
inherent O
limitations O
" " O
internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
may O
not O
prevent O
or O
detect O
misstatements O
. O

Also O
" " O
projections O
of O
any O
evaluation O
of O
effectiveness O
to O
future O
periods O
are O
subject O
to O
the O
risk O
that O
controls O
may O
become O
inadequate O
because O
of O
changes O
in O
conditions O
" " O
or O
that O
the O
degree O
of O
compliance O
with O
the O
policies O
or O
procedures O
may O
deteriorate O
. O

on O

our O

with O

of O

Public I-GOVERNMENT
Company I-GOVERNMENT

Basis O
of O
Presentation O
and O
Summary O
of O
Significant O
Accounting O
Policies O
: O
SunGard I-ORG
Data I-ORG
Systems I-ORG
Inc. I-ORG
( O
SunGard I-ORG
) O
was O
acquired O
on O
August O
11 O
" " O
2005 O
( O
the O
LBO O
) O
in O
a O
leveraged O
buy-out O
by O
a O
consortium O
of O
private O
equity O
investment O
funds O
associated O
with O
Bain I-ORG
Capital I-ORG
Partners I-ORG
" " O
The I-ORG
Blackstone I-ORG
Group I-ORG
" " O
Goldman I-ORG
Sachs I-ORG
& I-ORG
Co. I-ORG
" " O
Kohlberg I-ORG
Kravis I-ORG
Roberts I-ORG
& I-ORG
Co. I-ORG
" " O
Providence I-ORG
Equity I-ORG
Partners I-ORG
" " O
Silver I-ORG
Lake I-ORG
and I-ORG
TPG I-ORG
( O
collectively O
" " O
the O
Sponsors O
) O
. O

SunGard I-ORG
is O
a O
wholly O
owned O
subsidiary O
of O
SunGard I-ORG
Holdco I-ORG
LLC I-ORG
" " O
which O
is O
wholly O
owned O
by O
SunGard I-ORG
Holding I-ORG
Corp. I-ORG
" " O
which O
is O
wholly O
owned O
by O
SunGard I-ORG
Capital I-ORG
Corp. I-ORG
II I-ORG
( O
SCCII I-ORG
) O
" " O
which O
is O
a O
subsidiary O
of O
SunGard I-ORG
Capital I-ORG
Corp. I-ORG
( O
SCC I-ORG
) O
. O

SCC I-ORG
and O
SCCII I-ORG
are O
collectively O
referred O
to O
as O
the O
Parent O
Companies O
. O

All O
four O
of O
these O
companies O
were O
formed O
in O
2005 O
for O
the O
purpose O
of O
facilitating O
the O
LBO O
and O
are O
collectively O
referred O
to O
as O
the O
Holding O
Companies O
. O

SCC I-ORG
" " O
SCCII I-ORG
and O
SunGard I-ORG
are O
separate O
reporting O

Cash O
and O

Equivalents O
Cash O
and O

of O

that O
are O

into O

have O

of O
three O

or O

. O

Concentration O
of O
Credit O
Risk O
Financial O
instruments O
that O
potentially O
subject O
the O
Company O
to O
concentrations O
of O
credit O
risk O
consist O
primarily O
of O
accounts O
receivable O
. O

The O
Company O
sells O
a O
significant O
portion O
of O
its O
products O
and O
services O
to O
the O
financial O
services O
industry O
and O
could O
be O
affected O
by O
the O
overall O
condition O
of O
that O
industry O
. O

The O
Company O
believes O
that O
any O
credit O
risk O
associated O
with O
accounts O
receivable O
is O
substantially O
mitigated O
by O
the O
relatively O
large O
number O
of O
customer O
accounts O
and O
reasonably O
short O
collection O
terms O
. O

Accounts O
receivable O
are O
stated O
at O
estimated O
net O

value O
" " O
which O
approximates O
fair O
value O
. O

By O
policy O
" " O
the O
Company O
places O
its O
available O

and O
short-term O
investments O
with O
institutions O
of O
high O
credit-quality O
and O
limits O
the O
amount O
of O

exposure O
to O
any O
one O
issuer O
. O

Foreign O
Currency O
Translation O
The O
functional O
currency O
of O
each O
of O
the O
Company O
s O
foreign O
operations O
is O
generally O
the O
local O
currency O
of O
the O
country O
in O
which O
the O
operation O
is O
located O
. O

All O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
are O
translated O
into O
U.S. I-LOC
dollars O
using O
exchange O
rates O
in O
effect O
at O
the O
balance O
sheet O
date O
. O

Revenue O
and O
expenses O
are O
translated O
using O
average O
exchange O
rates O
during O
the O
period O
. O

Increases O
and O
decreases O
in O
net O
assets O
resulting O
from O
foreign O
currency O
translation O
are O
reflected O
in O
stockholder O
s O
equity O
as O
a O
component O
of O
accumulated O
other O
comprehensive O
income O
( O
loss O
) O
. O

Property O
and O
Equipment O
Property O
and O
equipment O
are O
recorded O
at O
cost O
and O
depreciated O
on O
the O
straight-line O
method O
over O
the O
estimated O
useful O
lives O
of O
the O
assets O
( O
three O
to O
eight O
years O
for O
equipment O
and O
ten O
to O
40 O
years O
for O
buildings O
and O
improvements O

Impairment O
Reviews O
for O
Long-Lived O
Assets O
The O
Company O
periodically O
reviews O
carrying O
values O
and O
useful O
lives O
of O
long-lived O
assets O
for O
impairment O
whenever O
events O
or O
changes O
in O
circumstances O
indicate O
that O
the O
carrying O
value O
of O
the O
asset O
may O
not O
be O
recoverable O
. O

Factors O
that O
could O
indicate O
an O
impairment O
include O
significant O
underperformance O
of O
the O
asset O
as O
compared O
to O
historical O
or O
projected O
future O
operating O
results O
" " O
or O
significant O
negative O
industry O
or O
economic O
trends O
. O

When O
the O
Company O
determines O
that O
the O
carrying O
value O
of O
an O
asset O
may O
not O
be O
recoverable O
" " O
the O
related O
estimated O
future O
undiscounted O
cash O
flows O
expected O
to O
result O
from O
the O
use O
and O
eventual O
disposition O
of O
the O
asset O
are O
compared O
to O
the O
carrying O
value O
of O
the O
asset O
. O

If O
the O
sum O
of O
the O
estimated O
future O
undiscounted O
cash O
flows O
is O
less O
than O
the O
carrying O
amount O
" " O
an O
impairment O
charge O
is O
recorded O
based O
on O
the O
difference O
between O
the O
carrying O
value O
of O
the O
asset O
and O
its O
fair O
value O
" " O
which O
the O
Company O
estimates O
based O
on O
discounted O
expected O
future O
cash O
flows O
. O

of O
costs O
" " O
estimated O

flows O
from O
the O
asset O
" " O
intended O
use O
of O
the O
asset O
and O
other O
relevant O
factors O
. O

If O
these O

or O
their O

change O
" " O

Stock O
Compensation O
Stock-based O
compensation O
cost O
is O
measured O
at O
the O
grant O
date O
based O
on O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
the O
award O
and O
is O
recognized O
as O
expense O
over O
the O
appropriate O
service O
period O
. O

Fair O
value O
for O
stock O
options O
is O
computed O
using O
the O
Black-Scholes I-MISC
pricing I-MISC
model I-MISC
. O

Determining O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
stock-based O
awards O
requires O
considerable O
judgment O
" " O
including O
estimating O
the O
expected O
term O
of O
stock O
options O
" " O
expected O
volatility O
of O
the O
Company O
s O
stock O
price O
" " O
and O
the O
number O
of O
awards O
expected O
to O
be O
forfeited O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
for O
stock-based O
awards O
where O
vesting O
is O
dependent O
upon O
achieving O
certain O
operating O
performance O
goals O
" " O
the O
Company O
estimates O
the O
likelihood O
of O
achieving O
the O
performance O
goals O
. O

Differences O
between O
actual O
results O
and O
these O
estimates O
could O
have O
a O
material O
effect O
on O
the O
consolidated O
financial O
results O
. O

A O
deferred O
income O
tax O
asset O
is O
recorded O
over O
the O
vesting O
period O
as O

is O

. O

The O

s O

to O

on O
the O

of O
the O

option O
upon O

or O
restricted O
stock O
unit O
upon O

. O

the O

of O
grant O
" " O

Income O
Taxes O
The O
Company O
recognizes O
deferred O
income O
tax O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
based O
upon O
the O
expected O
future O
tax O
consequences O
of O
events O
that O
have O
been O
recognized O
in O
the O
financial O
statements O
or O
tax O
returns O
. O

Deferred O
income O
tax O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
are O
calculated O
based O
on O
the O
difference O
between O
the O
financial O
and O
tax O
bases O
of O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
using O
the O
currently O
enacted O
income O
tax O
rates O
in O
effect O
during O
the O
years O
in O
which O
the O
differences O
are O
expected O
to O
reverse O
. O

Valuation O
allowances O
are O
recorded O
to O
reduce O
deferred O
tax O
assets O
when O
it O
is O
more O
likely O
than O
not O
that O
a O
tax O
benefit O
will O
not O
be O
realized O
. O

Deferred O
tax O
assets O
for O
which O
no O
valuation O
allowance O
is O
recorded O
may O
not O
be O
realized O
upon O
changes O
in O
facts O
and O
circumstances O
. O

Tax O
benefits O
related O
to O
uncertain O
tax O
positions O
taken O
or O
expected O
to O
be O
taken O
on O
a O
tax O
return O
are O
recorded O
when O
such O
benefits O
meet O
a O
more O
likely O
than O
not O
threshold O
. O

Otherwise O
" " O
these O
tax O
benefits O
are O
recorded O
when O
a O
tax O
position O
has O
been O
effectively O
settled O
" " O
which O
means O
that O
the O
appropriate O
taxing O
authority O
has O
completed O
their O
examination O
even O
though O
the O
statute O
of O
limitations O
remains O
open O
" " O
or O
the O
statute O
of O
limitation O
expires O
. O

Considerable O
judgment O
is O

and O

and O

between O

of O

A O

and O

SCCII O

Common O

" " O

Class O

terms O
as O
Class O
A O
common O
stock O
except O
as O
follows O
: O

In O
the O

These O

( O
between O

) O

. O
