Overview O
We O
are O
one O
of O
the O
world O
s O
leading O
software O
and O
technology O
services O
companies O
. O

We O
provide O
software O
and O
technology O
services O
to O
financial O
services O
" " O
higher O
education O
and O
public O
sector O
organizations O
. O

We O
also O
provide O
disaster O
recovery O
services O
" " O
managed O
services O
" " O
information O
availability O
consulting O
services O
and O
business O
continuity O
management O
software O
. O

We O
serve O
more O
than O
"25,000" O
customers O
in O
more O
than O
70 O
countries O
. O

Our O
high O
quality O
software O
solutions O
" " O
excellent O
customer O
support O
and O
specialized O
technology O
services O
result O
in O
strong O
customer O
retention O
rates O
across O
our O
business O
segments O
and O
create O
long-term O
customer O
relationships O
. O

We O
believe O
that O
we O
are O
one O
of O
the O
most O
efficient O
operators O
of O
mission-critical O
IT O
solutions O
as O
a O
result O
of O
the O
economies O
of O
scale O
we O
derive O
from O

Global O
Economic O
Conditions O
Current O

in O

" " O

and O

. O

" " O

. O

" " O

are O

Intangible O
Assets O
and O
Purchase O
Accounting O
Purchase O
accounting O
requires O
that O
all O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
be O
recorded O
at O
fair O
value O
on O
the O
acquisition O
date O
" " O
including O
identifiable O
intangible O
assets O
separate O
from O
goodwill O
. O

Identifiable O
intangible O
assets O
include O
customer O
base O
( O
which O
includes O
customer O
contracts O
and O
relationships O
) O
" " O
software O
and O
trade O
name O
. O

Goodwill O
represents O
the O
excess O
of O
cost O
over O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
net O
assets O
acquired O
. O

The O
estimated O
fair O
values O
and O
useful O
lives O
of O
identifiable O
intangible O
assets O
are O
based O
on O
many O
factors O
" " O
including O
estimates O
and O
assumptions O
of O
future O
operating O
performance O
and O
cash O
flows O
of O
the O
acquired O
business O
" " O
the O
nature O
of O
the O
business O
acquired O
" " O
the O
specific O
characteristics O
of O
the O
identified O
intangible O
assets O
" " O
and O
our O
historical O
experience O
and O
that O
of O
the O
acquired O
business O
. O

The O
estimates O
and O
assumptions O
used O
to O
determine O
the O
fair O
values O
and O
useful O
lives O
of O
identified O
intangible O
assets O
could O
change O
due O
to O
numerous O
factors O
" " O
including O
product O
demand O
" " O
market O
conditions O
" " O
technological O
developments O
" " O
economic O
conditions O
and O
competition O
. O

In O
connection O
with O
our O
determination O
of O
fair O

for O

LBO O
and O

other O
significant O
acquisitions O
" " O

to O

of O
intangible O
( O
and O
certain O

) O
assets O

and O
certain O
assumed O
obligations O
. O

We O
periodically O
review O
carrying O
values O
and O
useful O
lives O
of O
long-lived O
assets O
for O
impairment O
whenever O
events O
or O
changes O
in O
circumstances O
indicate O
that O
the O
carrying O
value O
of O
the O
asset O
may O
not O
be O
recoverable O
. O

Factors O
that O
could O
indicate O
an O
impairment O
include O
significant O
underperformance O
of O
the O
asset O
as O
compared O
to O
historical O
or O
projected O
future O
operating O
results O
" " O
or O
significant O
negative O
industry O
or O
economic O
trends O
. O

When O
we O
determine O
that O
the O
carrying O
value O
of O
an O
asset O
may O
not O
be O
recoverable O
" " O
the O
related O
estimated O
future O
undiscounted O
cash O
flows O
expected O
to O
result O
from O
the O
use O
and O
eventual O
disposition O
of O
the O
asset O
are O
compared O
to O
the O
carrying O
value O
of O
the O
asset O
. O

If O
the O
sum O
of O
the O
estimated O
future O
undiscounted O
cash O
flows O
is O
less O
than O
the O
carrying O
amount O
" " O
we O
record O
an O
impairment O
charge O
based O
on O
the O
difference O
between O
the O
carrying O
value O
of O
the O
asset O
and O
its O
fair O
value O
" " O
which O
we O
estimate O
based O
on O
discounted O
expected O
future O
cash O
flows O
. O

In O
determining O
whether O
an O
asset O
is O
impaired O
" " O
we O
make O
assumptions O
regarding O
recoverability O
of O
costs O
" " O
estimated O
future O
cash O
flows O
from O
the O
asset O
" " O
intended O
use O
of O
the O
asset O
and O
other O
relevant O
factors O
. O

If O
these O
estimates O
or O
their O
related O
assumptions O
change O
" " O
we O
may O
be O
required O
to O
record O
impairment O
charges O
for O
these O
assets O
. O

We O
are O
required O
to O
perform O
a O
goodwill O
impairment O
test O
" " O
a O
two-step O
test O
" " O
annually O
and O
more O
frequently O
when O
negative O
conditions O
or O
a O
triggering O
event O
arise O
. O

We O
complete O
our O
annual O
goodwill O
impairment O
test O
as O
of O
July O
1 O
. O

In O
step O
one O
" " O
the O
estimated O
fair O
value O
of O
each O
reporting O
unit O
is O
compared O
to O
its O
carrying O
value O
. O

We O
estimate O
the O
fair O
values O
of O
each O
reporting O
unit O
by O
a O
combination O
of O
( O
i O
) O
estimation O
of O
the O
discounted O
cash O
flows O
of O
each O
of O
the O
reporting O
units O
based O
on O
projected O
earnings O
in O
the O
future O
( O
the O
income O
approach O
) O
and O
( O
ii O
) O
a O
comparative O
analysis O
of O
revenue O
and O
EBITDA O
multiples O
of O
public O
companies O
in O
similar O
markets O
( O
the O
market O
approach O
) O
. O

If O
there O
is O
a O
deficiency O
( O
the O
estimated O
fair O
value O
of O
a O
reporting O
unit O
is O
less O
than O
the O
carrying O
value O
) O
" " O
a O
step O
two O
test O
is O
required O
. O

In O
step O
two O
" " O
the O
amount O
of O
any O
goodwill O
impairment O
is O
measured O
by O
comparing O
the O
implied O
fair O
value O
of O
the O
reporting O
unit O
s O
goodwill O
to O
the O
carrying O
value O
of O
goodwill O
" " O
with O
the O
resulting O
impairment O
reflected O
in O
operations O
. O

The O
implied O
fair O
value O
is O
determined O
in O
the O
same O
manner O
as O
the O
amount O
of O
goodwill O
recognized O
in O
a O
business O
combination O
. O

Estimating O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
a O
reporting O
unit O
requires O
various O
assumptions O
including O
projections O
of O
future O
cash O
flows O
" " O
perpetual O
growth O
rates O
and O
discount O
rates O
that O
reflect O
the O
risks O
associated O
with O
achieving O
those O
cash O
flows O
. O

The O
assumptions O
about O
future O
cash O
flows O
and O
growth O
rates O
are O
based O
on O

ASU I-LEGISLATION/ACT
2009-13 O
amended O
existing O
accounting O
guidance O
for O
revenue O
recognition O
for O
multiple-element O
arrangements O
by O
establishing O
a O
selling O
price O
hierarchy O
that O
allows O
for O
the O
best O
estimated O
selling O
price O
( O
BESP O
) O
to O
determine O

of O

to O
a O
deliverable O
in O

multiple O
element O
arrangement O
where O
neither O
vendor O
specific O
objective O
evidence O
( O
VSOE O
) O
nor O
third-party O
evidence O
( O
TPE O
) O
is O
available O
for O
that O
deliverable O
. O

ASU I-LEGISLATION/ACT
2009-14 O
modifies O
the O
scope O
of O
existing O
software O
guidance O
to O
exclude O
tangible O
products O
containing O
software O
components O
and O
non-software O
components O
that O
function O
together O
to O
deliver O
the O
product O
s O
essential O
functionality O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
ASU I-LEGISLATION/ACT
2009-14 O
provides O
guidance O
on O
how O
a O

should O
allocate O

to O

and O

products O
containing O

that O

in O

. O

. O

The O
following O
criteria O
must O
be O
met O
in O
determining O
whether O
revenue O
may O
be O
recorded O
: O
persuasive O
evidence O
of O
a O
contract O
exists O
; O
services O
have O
been O
provided O
; O
the O
price O
is O
fixed O
or O
determinable O
; O
and O
collection O
is O
reasonably O
assured O
. O

We O
generate O
revenue O
from O
the O
following O
sources O
: O
( O
1 O
) O
services O
revenue O
" " O
which O
includes O
revenue O
from O
processing O
services O
" " O
software O

and O
support O
" " O

" " O
recovery O
and O
managed O
services O
" " O
professional O
services O
and O

fees O
; O
and O
( O
2 O
) O
software O
license O
fees O
" " O
which O
result O
from O
contracts O
that O
permit O
the O
customer O
to O
use O
a O
SunGard O
product O
at O
the O
customer O
s O
site O
. O

Services O
revenue O
is O
recorded O
as O
the O
services O
are O
provided O
based O
on O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
each O
element O
. O

Most O
AS O
services O
revenue O
consists O
of O
fixed O
monthly O
fees O
based O
upon O
the O
specific O
computer O
configuration O
or O
business O
process O
for O
which O
the O
service O
is O
being O
provided O
. O

When O
recovering O
from O
an O
interruption O
" " O
customers O
generally O
are O
contractually O
obligated O
to O
pay O
additional O
fees O
" " O
which O
typically O
cover O
the O
incremental O
costs O
of O
supporting O
customers O
during O

. O

FS O
services O
revenue O
includes O
monthly O
fees O
" " O
which O
may O
include O
a O
fixed O
minimum O
fee O
and/or O
variable O
fees O
based O
on O
a O
measure O
of O
volume O
or O

" " O
such O
as O
the O
number O
of O
accounts O
" " O

or O

" " O
users O
or O
the O

of O
hours O
of O
service O
. O

For O

services O
contracts O
" " O
services O
revenue O
is O
recorded O
based O
upon O
proportional O
performance O
" " O
measured O
by O
the O
actual O
number O
of O

incurred O

by O
the O
total O

of O

for O

project O
. O

Changes O
in O
the O
estimated O
costs O
or O
hours O
to O
complete O
the O
contract O
and O
losses O
" " O
if O
any O
" " O
are O

in O
the O
period O
during O
which O
the O

or O

becomes O
known O
. O

License O
fees O
result O
from O
contracts O
that O
permit O
the O
customer O
to O
use O
a O
SunGard O
software O
product O
at O
the O
customer O
s O
site O
. O

Generally O
" " O
these O
contracts O
are O

arrangements O
since O
they O
usually O
provide O
for O
professional O
services O
and O

. O

In O

" " O

are O
recognized O

the O

of O
the O
contract O
and O

of O
the O
software O
if O

fee O
is O

or O

" " O
collection O
is O
probable O
" " O
and O
there O
is O
sufficient O

specific O
evidence O
of O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
each O

element O
. O

When O

are O
significant O
program O
modifications O
or O
customization O
" " O
installation O
" " O
systems O
integration O
or O
related O
services O
" " O
the O
professional O
services O
and O
license O
revenue O
are O
combined O
and O
recorded O
based O
upon O
proportional O
performance O
" " O
measured O
in O
the O
manner O
described O
above O
. O

Revenue O
is O
recorded O
when O
billed O
when O
customer O
payments O
are O
extended O
beyond O
normal O
billing O
terms O
" " O
or O
at O
acceptance O
when O
there O
is O
significant O
acceptance O
" " O
technology O
or O
service O
risk O
. O

Revenue O
also O
is O
recorded O
over O
the O
longest O
service O
period O
in O

where O

software O
is O

together O
with O
post-delivery O
services O
and O
there O
is O
not O
sufficient O
evidence O
of O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
each O
undelivered O
service O
element O
. O

With O
respect O
to O
software O
related O
multiple-element O
arrangements O
" " O
sufficient O
evidence O
of O
fair O
value O
is O
defined O
as O
VSOE O
. O

If O
there O
is O
no O
VSOE O
of O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
the O
delivered O
element O
( O
which O
is O
usually O
the O
software O
) O
but O
there O
is O
VSOE O
of O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
each O
of O
the O
undelivered O
elements O
( O
which O
are O
usually O
maintenance O
and O
professional O
services O
) O
" " O
then O
the O
residual O
method O
is O
used O
to O
determine O
the O
revenue O
for O
the O
delivered O
element O
. O

The O
revenue O
for O
each O
of O
the O
undelivered O
elements O
is O
set O
at O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
those O
elements O
using O
VSOE O
of O
the O
price O
paid O
when O
each O
of O
the O
undelivered O
elements O
is O
sold O
separately O
. O

The O
revenue O
remaining O
after O

to O

elements O
( O

" " O

) O
is O

to O
the O

element O
. O

VSOE O
supporting O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
maintenance O
is O
based O
on O
the O

rates O
for O

product O
and O
is O
typically O
18 O
% O
to O
20 O
% O
of O
the O
software O

fee O
per O

. O

VSOE O
supporting O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
professional O
services O
is O
based O
on O
the O
standard O
daily O
rates O
charged O
when O
those O

are O
sold O
separately O
. O

In O
some O
software O
related O
multiple-element O
arrangements O
" " O
the O
services O
rates O
are O
discounted O
. O

In O
these O
cases O
" " O
a O

of O

is O

and O
recognized O
as O
the O

are O

based O
on O
VSOE O
of O
the O
services O
. O

From O
time O
to O
time O

enter O

" " O

" " O
of O

software O
( O

) O
. O

accounted O
for O
as O
a O

unit O
of O

provided O

criteria O
are O

: O
the O

have O

" " O

For O
our O

" " O

allocate O
revenue O
to O

based O
on O
a O

hierarchy O
at O
the O

. O

During O
2008 O
and O
2009 O

of O

was O

using O

" " O

to O

. O

Under O
the O
new O
rules O
for O
2010 O
described O
above O
" " O

selling O
price O
for O
each O
element O
is O
based O
upon O
the O
following O
selling O
price O
hierarchy O
: O
VSOE O
then O
TPE O
then O
BESP O
. O

The O
total O
arrangement O
consideration O
is O
allocated O
to O
each O
separate O
unit O
of O
accounting O
for O
each O
of O
the O
non-software O

using O
the O
relative O
selling O

of O
each O
unit O
based O
on O
this O

. O

We O
limit O
the O

of O

recognized O
for O

elements O
to O
an O

that O
is O
not O

or O

or O

. O

Since O
under O
the O
new O
hierarchy O
a O
fair O
value O
for O
each O
element O
will O
be O
determinable O
" " O
the O
residual O
method O
is O
no O
longer O
used O
. O

To O
determine O
the O

in O

" " O

VSOE O
of O

Where O

" " O

is O
established O
by O
evaluating O
similar O
competitor O
products O
or O
services O
in O

with O
similarly O

. O

If O

to O

the O

because O

or O

doesn O
t O

" " O

BESP O
for O
the O
purposes O
of O
allocating O
the O
arrangement O
by O
considering O
pricing O
practices O
" " O
margin O
" " O
competition O
" " O
and O
geographies O
in O
which O
we O
offer O
our O
products O
and O
services O
. O

Unbilled O
receivables O
are O
created O
when O
services O
are O
performed O
or O
software O
is O
delivered O
and O
revenue O
is O
recognized O
in O
advance O
of O
billings O
. O

Deferred O
revenue O
is O
created O
when O
billing O
occurs O
in O
advance O
of O
performing O
services O
or O
when O
all O
revenue O
recognition O
criteria O
have O
not O
been O
met O
. O

We O
believe O
that O
our O
revenue O
recognition O
practices O
comply O
with O
the O
complex O
and O
evolving O
rules O
governing O
revenue O

. O

Future O

of O

" " O

or O

in O

in O

Accounting O
for O
Income O
Taxes O
We O
recognize O
deferred O
income O
tax O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
based O
upon O
the O
expected O
future O
tax O
consequences O
of O
events O
that O
have O
been O
recognized O
in O
our O
financial O
statements O
or O
tax O
returns O
. O

Deferred O
income O
tax O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
are O
calculated O
based O
on O
the O
difference O
between O
the O
financial O
and O
tax O
bases O
of O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
using O
the O
currently O
enacted O
income O
tax O
rates O
in O
effect O
during O
the O
years O
in O
which O
the O
differences O
are O
expected O
to O
reverse O
. O

Valuation O
allowances O
are O
recorded O
to O
reduce O
deferred O
tax O
assets O
when O
it O
is O
more O
likely O
than O
not O
that O
a O
tax O
benefit O
will O
not O
be O
realized O
. O

Deferred O
tax O
assets O
for O
which O
no O
valuation O
allowance O
is O
recorded O
may O
not O
be O
realized O
upon O
changes O
in O
facts O
and O
circumstances O
. O

Tax O
benefits O
related O
to O
uncertain O
tax O
positions O
taken O
or O
expected O
to O
be O
taken O
on O
a O
tax O
return O
are O
recorded O
when O
such O
benefits O
meet O
a O
more O
likely O
than O
not O
threshold O
. O

benefits O
are O
recorded O
when O
a O
tax O
position O
has O
been O
effectively O
settled O
" " O
which O
means O
that O
the O
appropriate O
taxing O
authority O
has O
completed O
their O
examination O
even O
though O
the O
statute O
of O
limitations O
remains O
open O
" " O
or O
the O
statute O
of O
limitation O
expires O
. O

Considerable O
judgment O
is O
required O
in O
assessing O
and O
estimating O
these O
amounts O
and O
differences O
between O
the O
actual O
outcome O
of O
these O
future O
tax O
consequences O
and O
our O
estimates O
could O
have O
a O
material O
effect O
on O
our O
consolidated O
financial O
results O
. O

Accounting O
for O
Stock-Based O
Compensation O
Stock-based O
compensation O
cost O
is O
measured O
at O
the O
grant O
date O
based O
on O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
the O
award O
and O
is O
recognized O
as O
expense O
over O
the O
appropriate O
service O
period O
. O

Fair O
value O
for O
stock O
options O
is O
computed O
using O
the O
Black-Scholes I-MISC
pricing I-MISC
model I-MISC
. O

Determining O
the O
fair O
value O
of O
stock-based O
awards O
requires O
considerable O
judgment O
" " O
including O
estimating O
the O
expected O
term O
of O
stock O
options O
" " O
expected O
volatility O
of O
our O
stock O
price O
" " O
and O
the O
number O
of O
awards O
expected O
to O
be O
forfeited O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
for O
stock-based O
awards O
where O
vesting O
is O
dependent O
upon O
achieving O
certain O
operating O
performance O
goals O
" " O
we O
estimate O
the O
likelihood O
of O
achieving O
the O
performance O
goals O
. O

Differences O
between O
actual O
results O
and O
these O
estimates O
could O
have O
a O
material O
effect O
on O
our O
consolidated O
financial O
results O
. O

A O
deferred O
income O
tax O
asset O
is O
recorded O
over O
the O
vesting O
period O
as O
stock O
compensation O
expense O
is O
recognized O
. O

Our O
ability O
to O
use O
the O
deferred O
tax O
asset O
is O
ultimately O
based O
on O
the O
actual O
value O
of O
the O
stock O
option O
upon O
exercise O
or O
restricted O
stock O
unit O
upon O
distribution O
. O

If O
the O
actual O
value O
is O
lower O
than O
the O
fair O
value O
determined O
on O
the O
date O
of O
grant O
" " O
then O
there O
could O
be O
an O
income O
tax O
expense O
for O
the O

of O

deferred O
tax O
asset O
that O
can O
not O
be O
used O
" " O
which O
could O
have O
a O
material O
effect O
on O
our O
consolidated O
financial O
results O
. O

Adjusted O
earnings O
before O
interest O
" " O

" " O

and O

( O
EBITDA O
) O
is O
a O
non-GAAP I-MISC
measure O
used O
to O
determine O
our O
compliance O
with O
certain O
covenants O
contained O
in O
the O
indentures O
governing O
the O
senior O
notes O
due O
2015 O
" " O
2018 O
and O
2020 O
and O
senior O
subordinated O
notes O
due O
2015 O
and O
in O
our O
senior O
secured O
credit O
facilities O
. O

Adjusted O
EBITDA O
is O
defined O
as O
EBITDA O
further O
adjusted O
to O
exclude O
unusual O
items O
and O
other O
adjustments O
permitted O
in O
calculating O
covenant O
compliance O
under O
the O
indentures O
and O
our O
senior O
secured O
credit O
facilities O
. O

We O
believe O
that O
including O
supplementary O
information O
concerning O
Adjusted O
EBITDA O
is O
appropriate O
to O
provide O
additional O
information O
to O
investors O
to O
demonstrate O
compliance O
with O
our O
financing O
covenants O
. O

The O
breach O
of O
covenants O
in O
our O
senior O
secured O
credit O
facilities O
that O
are O
tied O
to O
ratios O
based O
on O
Adjusted O
EBITDA O
could O
result O
in O
a O
default O
and O
the O
lenders O
could O
elect O
to O
declare O
all O
amounts O
borrowed O
due O
and O
payable O
. O

Any O
such O
acceleration O
would O
also O
result O
in O
a O
default O
under O
our O
indentures O
. O

Additionally O
" " O
under O
our O
debt O
agreements O
" " O
our O
ability O
to O
engage O
in O
activities O
such O
as O
incurring O
additional O
indebtedness O
" " O
making O

and O

is O
also O
tied O
to O
ratios O
based O
on O
Adjusted O
EBITDA O
. O

Adjusted O
EBITDA O
does O
not O
represent O
net O
income O
( O
loss O
) O
or O
cash O
flow O
from O
operations O
as O
those O
terms O
are O
defined O
by O
GAAP I-MISC
and O
does O
not O
necessarily O
indicate O
whether O
cash O
flows O
will O
be O
sufficient O
to O
fund O
cash O
needs O
. O

While O
Adjusted O
EBITDA O
and O
similar O
measures O
are O
frequently O
used O
as O
measures O
of O
operations O
and O
the O
ability O
to O
meet O
debt O
service O
requirements O
" " O

terms O
are O
not O
necessarily O
comparable O
to O
other O

captions O
of O
other O
companies O
due O
to O
the O

in O
the O
method O
of O
calculation O
. O

Adjusted O
EBITDA O
does O
not O
reflect O
the O
impact O
of O
earnings O
or O
charges O
resulting O
from O
matters O
that O
we O
may O
consider O
not O
to O

of O

. O

In O

" " O

of O

to O

" " O

( O

) O

However O
" " O

are O

that O
may O

" " O
vary O

and O
are O
difficult O
to O

. O

Further O
" " O

As O

defaults O
and O
other O
market O
factors O
. O

Due O
to O
the O
loss-share O
agreement O
with O
the O
FDIC I-GOVERNMENT
" " O
the O

recorded O
a O

from O
the O
FDIC I-GOVERNMENT
equal O
to O
the O
present O
value O
of O
the O
corresponding O
reimbursement O
percentages O
on O
the O
estimated O
losses O
embedded O
in O
the O
loan O

. O

Management O
has O
an O
established O
methodology O
to O
determine O
the O

of O
the O

for O

in O

. O

For O

for O

. O

Loans O
are O

into O
the O
following O
pools O
: O

" " O

" " O
residential O

loans O
" " O
and O

. O

Historical O

for O

are O

and O
used O

. O

These O

for O

. O

Certain O

are O

to O
the O

allocation O
percentage O
to O
get O
the O
adjusted O
factor O
to O
be O
applied O
to O
nonclassified O
loans O
. O

The O
following O

are O

for O

: O

are O

and O

relevant O

within O
the O
portfolio O
. O

During O

. O

is O
based O
on O

with O
similarly O

. O

The O
Company O
's O

grades O
are O
as O
follows O
: O

Pass O
– O

which O
are O
protected O
by O
the O
current O

and O
paying O
capacity O
of O
the O

the O
value O
of O

. O

There O
are O
three O

within O
the O
pass O
category O
to O
further O

the O
loan O
. O

Special O
Mention O
– O
loans O
where O
a O

or O
risk O
exists O
" " O
which O
could O

. O

Substandard O
– O

that O
have O
a O

weakness O
based O
on O

evidence O
and O
are O
characterized O
by O
the O
distinct O

that O
the O
Bank O
will O
sustain O
some O
loss O
if O
the O
deficiencies O
are O
not O
corrected O
. O

Doubtful O
– O
loans O
classified O
as O
doubtful O
have O
all O
the O

inherent O
in O
a O
substandard O
asset O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
these O

make O
collection O

liquidation O
in O
full O
highly O
questionable O
and O
improbable O
" " O
based O
on O
existing O
circumstances O
. O

Loss O
– O

classified O
as O
a O
loss O
are O
considered O
uncollectible O
" " O
or O
of O
such O
value O
that O

. O

Generally I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Accepted I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Accounting I-LEGISLATION/ACT
Principles I-LEGISLATION/ACT
( O
“ O
GAAP I-LEGISLATION/ACT
” O
) O
establishes O
a O
hierarchal O
disclosure O
framework O
associated O
with O
the O
level O
of O
pricing O
observability O
utilized O
in O
measuring O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
at O
fair O
value O
. O

The O
three O
broad O
levels O
defined O
by O
GAAP I-LEGISLATION/ACT
hierarchy O
are O
as O
follows O
: O

Level O
I O
: O
Quoted O
prices O
are O
available O
in O
active O
markets O
for O
identical O
assets O
or O
liabilities O
as O
of O
the O
reported O
date O
. O

Level O
II O
: O
Pricing O
inputs O
are O
other O
than O
the O
quoted O
prices O
in O
active O
markets O
" " O
which O
are O
either O
directly O
or O
indirectly O
observable O
as O
of O
the O
reported O
date O
. O

The O
nature O
of O
these O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
includes O
items O
for O
which O
quoted O
prices O
are O
available O
but O
traded O
less O
frequently O
and O
items O
that O
are O
fair-valued O
using O
other O
financial O
instruments O
" " O
the O
parameters O
of O
which O
can O
be O
directly O
observed O
. O

Level O
III O
: O
Assets O
and O
liabilities O
that O
have O
little O
to O
no O
pricing O
observability O
as O
of O
the O
reported O
date O
. O

These O
items O
do O
not O
have O
two-way O
markets O
and O
are O
measured O
using O
management O
’ O
s O
best O
estimate O
of O
fair O
value O
" " O
where O
the O
inputs O
into O
the O
determination O
of O
fair O
value O
require O
significant O
management O
judgment O
or O
estimation O
. O

The O
following O
table O
presents O
the O
assets O
reported O
on O
the O
consolidated O
balance O
sheets O
at O
their O
fair O
value O
as O
of O
March O
31 O
" " O
2011 O
and O
December O
31 O
" " O
2010 O
" " O
respectively O
" " O
by O
level O
within O
the O
fair O
value O
hierarchy O
. O

As O
required O
by O
GAAP I-LEGISLATION/ACT
" " O
financial O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
are O
classified O
in O
their O
entirety O
based O
on O
the O
lowest O
level O
of O
input O
that O
is O
significant O
to O
the O
fair O
value O
measurement O
. O

All O
of O
the O
securities O
classified O
as O
available O
for O
sale O
are O
reported O

fair O
value O

Level O
2 O
inputs O
. O

For O
these O
securities O
" " O

Company O
obtains O
fair O
value O
measurements O
from O
an O
independent O

service O
. O

The O

value O

consider O
observable O
data O
that O
may O
include O
dealer O
quoted O
market O
spreads O
" " O
cash O
flows O
" " O
the O
U.S. I-GOVERNMENT
Treasury I-GOVERNMENT
yield O
curve O
" " O
live O
trading O
levels O
" " O
trade O
execution O
data O
" " O
market O
consensus O
prepayment O
speeds O
" " O
credit O
information O
and O
the O
bond O
’ O
s O
terms O
and O
conditions O
" " O
among O
other O
things O
. O

In O
certain O
cases O
" " O

inputs O
used O
to O
measure O

value O
may O

into O

levels O
of O

fair O

. O

In O
such O
cases O
" " O
the O
level O
in O
the O
fair O
value O
hierarchy O
" " O
within O
which O
the O
fair O
value O
measurement O
in O
its O
entirety O
falls O
" " O
has O
been O
determined O
based O
on O
the O
lowest O
level O
input O
that O
is O
significant O
to O
the O
fair O
value O
measurement O
in O
its O
entirety O
. O

The O
Company O
’ O
s O
assessment O
of O
the O
significance O
of O
a O
particular O
input O
to O
the O
fair O
value O
measurement O
in O
its O
entirety O
requires O
judgment O
" " O
and O
considers O
factors O
specific O
to O
the O
asset O
. O

The O
measurement O
of O
fair O
value O
should O
be O
consistent O
with O
one O
of O
the O
following O
valuation O
techniques O
: O
market O
approach O
" " O
income O
approach O
" " O
and/or O
cost O
approach O
. O

The O
market O
approach O
uses O
prices O
and O
other O
relevant O
information O
generated O
by O
market O
transactions O
involving O
identical O
or O
comparable O
assets O
or O
liabilities O
( O
including O
a O
business O
) O
. O

For O
example O
" " O
valuation O
techniques O
consistent O
with O
the O
market O
approach O
often O
use O
market O
multiples O
derived O
from O
a O
set O
of O
comparables O
. O

Multiples O
might O
lie O
in O
ranges O
with O
a O
different O
multiple O
for O
each O
comparable O
. O

The O
selection O
of O
where O
within O
the O
range O
the O
appropriate O
multiple O
falls O
requires O
judgment O
" " O
considering O
factors O
specific O
to O
the O
measurement O
( O
qualitative O
and O
quantitative O
) O
. O

Valuation O
techniques O
consistent O
with O
the O
market O
approach O
include O
matrix O
pricing O
. O

Matrix O
pricing O
is O
a O
mathematical O
technique O
used O
principally O
to O
value O
debt O
securities O
without O
relying O
exclusively O
on O
quoted O
prices O
for O
the O
specific O
securities O
" " O
but O
rather O
by O
relying O
on O
the O
securities O
’ O
relationship O
to O
other O
benchmark O
quoted O
securities O
. O

As O
of O
March O
31 O
" " O
2011 O
" " O
all O
of O
the O
financial O
assets O
measured O
at O
fair O
value O
utilized O
the O
market O
approach O
. O

The O
estimated O
fair O
values O
of O
the O

’ O
s O
financial O
instruments O
are O
as O
follows O
: O

Financial O
instruments O
are O
defined O
as O
cash O
" " O
evidence O
of O
ownership O
interest O
in O
an O
entity O
" " O
or O
a O
contract O
that O
creates O
an O
obligation O
or O
right O
to O
receive O
or O
deliver O
cash O
or O
another O
financial O
instrument O
from/to O
a O
second O
entity O
on O
potentially O
favorable O
or O
unfavorable O
terms O
. O

Fair O
value O
is O
defined O
as O
the O
amount O
at O
which O
a O
financial O
instrument O
could O
be O
exchanged O
in O
a O
current O
transaction O
between O
willing O
parties O
other O

in O

or O

. O

If O
a O

market O
price O
is O
available O
for O
a O

instrument O
" " O

would O
be O

based O
upon O
the O
market O

per O

of O
the O

. O

If O
no O
readily O

market O
exists O
" " O

for O

’ O

regarding O

" " O

risk O
" " O
expected O

" " O

option O

. O

As O

Demand O

SecuritiesSecurities O

Allowance O
for O
loan O
lossesThe O

for O

is O

to O

and O

( O

of O

) O
. O

Company O
’ O
s O

experience O

and O
composition O
of O

loan O

" " O

. O

A O

to O
support O
the O
adequacy O
of O
the O
allowance O
for O
loan O
losses O
. O

This O
analysis O
includes O
review O
of O
historical O
charge-off O
rates O
for O
loan O
categories O
" " O
fluctuations O
and O
trends O
in O
the O
amount O
of O
classified O
loans O
and O
economic O
factors O
. O

Significant O
to O
this O
analysis O
are O
any O
changes O
in O
observable O
trends O
that O
may O
be O
occurring O
relative O
to O
loans O
to O
assess O
potential O
weaknesseswithin O
the O
credit O
. O

Current O
economic O
factors O
and O
trends O
in O
risk O
ratings O
are O
considered O
in O
the O

and O
allocation O
of O
the O
allowance O
for O
loan O

. O

Income O
taxes.The O
Company O
files O
a O
consolidated O
federal O
income O
tax O
return O
. O

Deferred O
tax O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
are O
computed O
based O
on O
the O
difference O
between O
the O
financial O
statement O
and O
the O
income O
tax O
basis O
of O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
using O
the O
enacted O
marginal O
tax O
rates O
. O

Deferred O
income O
taxes O
or O
benefits O
are O
based O
on O
changes O
in O
the O
deferred O
tax O
asset O
or O
liability O
from O
period O
to O
period O
. O

Deferred O
tax O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
are O
reflected O
at O
currently O
enacted O
income O
tax O
rates O
applicable O
to O
the O
period O
in O
which O
such O
items O
are O
expected O
to O
be O
realized O
or O
settled O
. O

As O
changes O
in O
tax O
rates O
are O
enacted O
" " O

tax O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
are O
adjusted O
through O
the O
provision O
for O
income O
taxes O
. O

Liquidity O
is O
the O
ability O
to O
meet O
current O
and O
future O
financial O
obligations O
of O
a O
short-term O
nature O
. O

Our O
primary O
sources O
of O
funds O
consist O
of O
deposit O
inflows O
" " O
loan O
repayments O
" " O
maturities O
and O
sales O
of O
securities O
and O
borrowings O
from O
the O
FHLB I-GOVERNMENT
of I-GOVERNMENT
Pittsburgh I-GOVERNMENT
. O

While O
maturities O
and O
scheduled O
amortization O
of O
loans O
and O
securities O
are O
predictable O
sources O
of O
funds O
" " O
deposit O
flows O
and O
loan O
prepayments O
are O
greatly O
influenced O
by O
general O
interest O
rates O
" " O
economic O
conditions O
and O
competition O
. O

We O
regularly O
adjust O
our O
investments O
in O
liquid O
assets O
based O
upon O
our O
assessment O
of O
( O
1 O
) O
expected O
loan O
demand O
" " O
( O
2 O
) O
expected O
deposit O
flows O
" " O
( O
3 O
) O
yields O
available O
on O
interest-earning O
deposits O
and O
securities O
and O
( O
4 O
) O
the O
objectives O
of O
our O
asset/liability O
management O
policy O
. O

Our O
most O
liquid O
assets O
are O
cash O
and O
cash O
equivalents O
. O

The O
levels O
of O
these O
assets O
depend O
on O
our O
operating O
" " O
financing O
" " O
lending O
and O
investing O
activities O
during O
any O
given O
period O
. O

At O
March O
31 O
" " O
2011 O
" " O
cash O
and O
cash O
equivalents O
totaled O
$ O
8.0 O
million O
. O

Securities O
classified O
as O
available-for-sale O
" " O
which O
provide O
additional O
sources O
of O
liquidity O
" " O

Market O
Overview O
Taking O
its O
cues O
from O
a O
rally O
in O
stocks O
and O
other O
credit O
markets O
" " O
pricing O
in O
the O
CMBS O
market O
has O
continued O
to O
improve O
since O
April O
despite O
a O
continued O
weakening O
in O
commercial O
real O
estate O
fundamentals O
. O

Average O
spreads O
on O
Super I-MISC
Senior I-MISC
AAAs I-MISC
eligible O
for O
the O
Term I-MISC
Asset-Backed I-MISC
Securities I-MISC
Loan I-MISC
Facility I-MISC
( O
TALF I-MISC
) O
have O
tightened O
dramatically O
" " O
from O
625bp O
at O
the O
end O
of O
April O
to O
as O
low O
as O
400 O
bp O
in O
mid-July O
after O
the O
first O
round O
of O
TALF I-MISC
funding O
for O
legacy O
CMBS O
was O
successfully O
completed O
. O

Spreads O
on O
Super I-MISC
Senior I-MISC
AAAs I-MISC
not O
eligible O
for O
TALF I-MISC
were O
in O
the O
mid O
700s O
at O
the O
end O
of O
April O
and O
tightened O
to O
the O
low O
500s O
by O
early O
August O
in O
anticipation O
of O
demand O
for O
such O
investments O
by O
asset O
managers O
in O
the O
Public-Private I-MISC
Investment I-MISC
Program I-MISC
( O
PPIP I-MISC
) O
. O

On O
the O
heels O
of O
this O
technical O
rally O
" " O
many O
insurance O
companies O
and O
money O
managers O
looked O
for O
opportunities O
to O
sell O
" " O
pushing O
spreads O
back O
out O
to O
the O
high O
400s O
for O
TALF-eligible I-MISC
and O
high O
600s O
for O
non O
TALF-eligible I-MISC
bonds O
. O

However O
" " O
this O
supply O
was O
gradually O
absorbed O
and O
the O
broader O
economic O
sentiment O
continued O
to O
improve O
into O
Q4 O
. O

By O
the O
end O
of O
October O
" " O
spreads O
on O
Super I-MISC
Senior I-MISC
AAAs I-MISC
" " O
eligible O
and O
non-eligible O
for O
TALF I-MISC
" " O
reached O
the O
mid O
300s O
and O
mid O
500s O
" " O
respectively O
. O

Bonds O
rated O
below O
AAA I-MISC
also O
enjoyed O
a O
small O
rally O
in O
price O
in O
spite O
of O
an O
increase O
in O
the O
CMBS O
conduit O

rate O
from O
2.45 O
% O
at O
the O
end O
of O
April O
to O
4.80 O
% O
at O
the O
end O
of O
October1 O
. O

Some O
of O
the O
recent O
price O
gains O
have O
been O
attributed O
to O
a O
ruling O
by O
the O
Treasury I-GOVERNMENT
Department I-GOVERNMENT
that O
provides O
special O
servicers O
with O
greater O
leeway O
to O
conduct O
modifications O
on O
loans O
in O
advance O
of O
mortgages O
becoming O
delinquent O
. O

Prior O
to O
the O
change O
" " O
special O
servicers O
were O
restricted O
from O
modifying O
loans O
unless O
loans O
were O
in O
imminent O
default O
or O
had O
defaulted O
. O

REPORT O
2009 O

CLARION I-ORG

The O
new O
guidance O
enables O
distressed O
borrowers O
to O
initiate O
conversations O
with O
special O
servicers O
to O
proactively O
evaluate O
their O
mortgages O
in O
hopes O
of O
averting O
foreclosure O
. O

These O
changes O
generated O
renewed O
interest O
in O
more O
credit O
sensitive O
classes O
of O
CMBS O
as O
the O
prospects O
for O
immediate O
liquidation O
of O
delinquent O
loans O
into O
a O
depressed O
market O
diminished O
. O

However O
" " O
most O
lower O
rated O
CMBS O
positions O
still O
trade O
for O
pennies O
on O
the O
dollar O
as O
most O
investors O
recognize O
that O
the O
new O
guidance O
may O
simply O
delay O
" " O
rather O
than O
eliminate O
" " O
impending O
defaults O
. O

The O
CMBS O
market O
recently O
received O
some O
welcome O
news O
in O
the O
form O
of O
the O
first O
U.S. I-LOC
CMBS O
deal O
consisting O
of O
newly O
originated O
collateral O
issued O
in O
almost O
a O
year O
and O
a O
half O
. O

The O
Developers O
Diversified O
Realty O
deal O
was O
issued O
into O
strong O
demand O
and O
priced O
at O
tighter O
than O
expected O
spreads O
with O
the O
TALF I-MISC
eligible O
AAA I-MISC
tranche O
pricing O
at O
140bp O
over O
swaps O
. O

The O
deal O
featured O
notable O
differences O
to O
the O
traditional O
CMBS O
structure O
" " O
including O
a O
simplified O
low O
leverage O
three O
tranche O
structure O
. O

The O
mortgage O
collateral O
was O
also O
more O
conservatively O
underwritten O
than O
those O
of O
the O
recent O
past O
" " O
with O
a O
debt O
coverage O
ratio O
of O
2.04x O
and O
an O
LTV O
of O
51.7 O
% O
2 O
. O

With O
respect O
to O
non-securitized O
CRE O
debt O
" " O
both O
statistical O
and O
anecdotal O
evidence O
points O
to O
further O
deterioration O
within O
institutional O
loan O
portfolios O
" " O
primarily O
banks O
. O

As O
of O
September O
30 O
" " O
2009 O
" " O
the O
national O
average O
default O
rate O
for O
commercial O
real O
estate O
mortgages O
held O
by O
financial O
institutions O
rose O
to O
3.40 O
% O
( O
up O
from O
2.88 O
% O
three O
months O
earlier3 O
) O
. O

We O
expect O
that O
this O
deterioration O
will O
continue O
to O
put O
pressure O
on O
financial O
institutions O
. O

However O
" " O
the O
current O
low O
interest O
rate O
environment O
is O
providing O
breathing O
room O
for O
these O
financial O
institutions O
that O
hope O
to O
earn O
their O
way O
out O
of O
the O
crisis O
. O

Given O
the O
general O
uncertainty O
in O
commercial O
real O
estate O
debt O
markets O
" " O
we O
continue O
to O
position O
the O
Master O
Fund O
in O
seasoned O
securities O
and O
securities O
with O
significant O
amounts O
of O
credit O
enhancement O
. O

We O
believe O
that O
this O
position O
will O
be O
beneficial O
to O
the O
Fund O
in O
the O
event O
of O
continued O
weakness O
in O
commercial O
real O
estate O
fundamentals O
. O

of O
October O
31 O
" " O
2009 O
" " O
96.1 O

of O

FUND O
OBJECTIVE O
Clarion I-ORG
Value I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
Master I-ORG
" " I-ORG
LLC I-ORG
( O
the O
Master O
Fund O
) O
seeks O
to O
generate O
high O
current O
income O
by O
selecting O
investments O
based O
on O
fundamental O
analysis O
and O
relative O
value O
. O

INVESTMENT O
STRATEGY O
The O
Master O
Fund O
s O
investment O
approach O
identifies O
investments O
with O
potential O
for O
capital O
appreciation O
based O
on O
credit O
upgrades O
and O
other O
factors O
. O

The O
majority O
of O
the O
securities O
in O
which O
the O
Master O
Fund O
invests O
are O
commercial O
mortgage O
backed O
securities O
with O
a O
maturity O
of O
2 O
to O
20 O
years O
. O

The O
portfolio O
is O
actively O
managed O
to O
enhance O
return O
and O
to O
mitigate O
downside O
risk O
. O

ANNUAL O
REPORT O
2009 O
| O
CLARION I-ORG
VALUE I-ORG

" " I-ORG

REPORT O
OF O
INDEPENDENT O
REGISTERED O
PUBLIC O
ACCOUNTING O
FIRM O
CLARION I-ORG
VALUE I-ORG
FUND I-ORG
" " I-ORG
INC. I-ORG

To O
the O
Board O
of O
Directors O
and O
Shareholders O
of O
Clarion I-ORG
Value I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
" " I-ORG
Inc. I-ORG
: O
We O
have O
audited O
the O
accompanying O
statement O
of O
assets O
and O
liabilities O
of O
Clarion I-ORG
Value I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
" " I-ORG
Inc. I-ORG
( O
the O
Fund O
) O
" " O
as O
of O
October O
31 O
" " O
2009 O
" " O
and O
the O
related O
statements O
of O
operations O
and O
cash O
flows O
for O
the O
year O
then O
ended O
" " O
the O
statements O
of O
changes O
in O
net O
assets O
for O
each O
of O
the O
two O
years O
in O
the O
period O
then O
ended O
" " O
and O
the O
financial O
highlights O
for O
each O
of O
the O
five O
years O
in O
the O
period O
then O
ended O
. O

These O
financial O
statements O
and O
financial O
highlights O
are O
the O
responsibility O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
management O
. O

Our O
responsibility O
is O
to O
express O
an O
opinion O
on O
these O
financial O
statements O
and O
financial O
highlights O
based O
on O
our O
audits O
. O

We O
conducted O
our O
audits O
in O
accordance O
with O
the O
Standards O
of O
the O
Public I-GOVERNMENT
Company I-GOVERNMENT
Accounting I-GOVERNMENT
Oversight I-GOVERNMENT
Board I-GOVERNMENT
( I-GOVERNMENT
United I-GOVERNMENT
States I-GOVERNMENT
) I-GOVERNMENT
. O

Those O
standards O
require O
that O
we O
plan O
and O
perform O
the O
audit O
to O
obtain O
reasonable O
assurance O
about O
whether O
the O
financial O
statements O
and O
financial O
highlights O
are O
free O
of O
material O
misstatement O
. O

We O
were O
not O
engaged O
to O
perform O
an O
audit O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
. O

Our O
audits O
included O
consideration O
of O
internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
as O
a O
basis O
for O
designing O
audit O
procedures O
that O
are O
appropriate O
in O
the O
circumstances O
" " O
but O
not O
for O
the O
purpose O
of O
expressing O
an O
opinion O
on O
the O
effectiveness O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
internal O
control O
over O
financial O
reporting O
. O

Accordingly O
" " O
we O
express O
no O
such O
opinion O
. O

An O
audit O
also O
includes O
examining O
" " O
on O
a O
test O
basis O
" " O
evidence O
supporting O
the O
amounts O
and O
disclosures O
in O
the O
financial O
statements O
and O
financial O
highlights O
" " O
assessing O
the O
accounting O
principles O
used O
and O
significant O
estimates O
made O
by O
management O
" " O
and O
evaluating O
the O
overall O
financial O
statement O
presentation O
. O

We O
believe O
that O
our O
audits O
provide O
a O
reasonable O
basis O
for O
our O
opinion O
. O

In O
our O
opinion O
" " O
the O
financial O
statements O
and O
financial O
highlights O
referred O
to O
above O
present O
fairly O
" " O
in O
all O
material O
respects O
" " O
the O
financial O
position O
of O
Clarion I-ORG
Value I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
" " I-ORG
Inc. I-ORG
at O
October O
31 O
" " O
2009 O
" " O
the O
results O
of O
its O
operations O
and O
its O
cash O
flows O
for O
the O
year O
then O
ended O
" " O
the O
changes O
in O
its O
net O
assets O
for O
each O
of O
the O
two O
years O
in O
the O
period O
then O
ended O
" " O
and O
the O
financial O
highlights O
for O
each O
of O
the O
five O
years O
in O
the O
period O
then O
ended O
" " O
in O
conformity O
with O
U.S. I-LEGISLATION/ACT
generally I-LEGISLATION/ACT

ANNUAL O
REPORT O
2009 O
| O
CLARION I-ORG
VALUE I-ORG
FUND I-ORG
" " I-ORG
Inc. I-ORG

FUND O
EXPENSES O
( O
unaudited O
) O
CLARION I-ORG
VALUE I-ORG
FUND I-ORG
" " I-ORG
INC. I-ORG

As O
a O
shareholder O
of O
the O
Fund O
" " O
you O
incur O
two O
types O
of O
costs O
: O
( O
1 O
) O
transaction O
costs O
" " O
which O
may O
include O
sales O
charges O
( O
loads O
) O
on O
purchase O
payments O
and O
contingent O
deferred O
sales O
charges O
on O
redemptions O
and O
( O
2 O
) O
ongoing O
costs O
" " O
including O
management O
fees O
and O
other O
Fund O
expenses O
. O

This O
example O
is O
intended O
to O
help O
you O
understand O
your O
ongoing O
costs O
( O
in O
dollars O
) O
of O
investing O
in O
the O
Fund O
and O
to O
compare O
these O
costs O
with O
the O
ongoing O
costs O
of O
investing O
in O
other O
mutual O
funds O
. O

The O
example O
is O
based O
on O
an O
investment O
of O
$ O
"1,000" O
invested O
at O
the O
beginning O
of O
the O
period O
and O
held O
for O
the O
entire O
period O
as O
indicated O
below O
. O

ACTUAL O
EXPENSES O
The O
first O
line O
of O
the O
table O
provides O
information O
about O
actual O
account O
values O
and O
actual O
expenses O
. O

You O
may O
use O
the O
information O
in O
this O
line O
" " O
together O
with O
the O
amount O
you O
invested O
" " O
to O
estimate O
the O
expenses O
that O
you O
paid O
over O
the O
period O
. O

Simply O
divide O
the O
account O
value O
by O
$ O
"1,000" O
( O
for O
example O
" " O
an O
$ O
"8,600" O
account O
value O
divided O
by O
$ O
"1,000" O
= O
8.6 O
) O
" " O
then O
multiply O
the O
result O
by O
the O
number O
in O
the O
first O
line O
under O
the O
heading O
entitled O
Expenses O
Paid O
During O
the O
Period O
to O
estimate O
the O
expenses O
you O
paid O
on O
your O
account O
during O
this O
period O
. O

HYPOTHETICAL O
EXAMPLE O
FOR O
COMPARISON O
PURPOSES O
The O
second O
line O
of O
the O
table O
below O
provides O
information O
about O
hypothetical O
account O
values O
and O
hypothetical O
expenses O
based O
on O
the O
Fund O
s O
actual O
expense O
ratio O
and O
an O
assumed O
annual O
rate O
of O
return O
of O
5 O
% O
before O
expenses O
" " O
which O
is O
not O
the O
Fund O
s O
actual O
return O
. O

The O
hypothetical O
account O
values O
and O
expenses O
may O
not O
be O
used O
to O
estimate O
the O
actual O
ending O
account O
balance O
or O
expenses O
you O
paid O
for O
the O
period O
. O

You O
may O
use O
this O
information O
to O
compare O
the O
ongoing O
costs O
of O
investing O
in O
the O
Fund O
and O
other O
funds O
by O
comparing O
this O
5 O
% O
hypothetical O
example O
with O
the O
5 O
% O
hypothetical O
examples O
that O
appear O
in O
the O
shareholder O
reports O
of O
other O
funds O
. O

Please O
note O
that O
the O
expenses O
shown O
in O
the O
table O
are O
meant O
to O
highlight O
your O
ongoing O
costs O
only O
and O
do O
not O
reflect O
any O
transactional O
costs O
" " O
such O
as O
sales O
charges O
( O
loads O
) O
or O
contingent O
deferred O
sales O
charges O
on O
redemptions O
. O

Therefore O
" " O
the O
second O
line O
of O
the O
table O
is O
useful O
in O
comparing O
ongoing O
costs O
only O
" " O
and O
will O
not O
help O
you O
determine O
the O
relative O
total O
costs O
of O
owning O
different O
funds O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
if O
these O
transactional O
costs O
were O
included O
" " O
your O
costs O
would O
have O
been O
higher O
. O

A O
description O
of O
the O
Fund O
s O
proxy O
voting O
policies O
and O
procedures O
related O
to O
portfolio O
securities O
is O
available O
without O
charge O
" " O
upon O
request O
" " O
by O
calling O
the O
Fund O
at O
( O
212 O
) O
883-2750 O
or O
on O
the O
Securities I-GOVERNMENT
& I-GOVERNMENT
Exchange I-GOVERNMENT
Commission I-GOVERNMENT
s O
website O
at O
http O
: O
//www.sec.gov O
. O

Information O
regarding O
how O
the O
Fund O
voted O
proxies O
for O
portfolio O
securities O
" " O
if O
applicable O
" " O
during O
the O
most O
recent O
12-month O
period O
ended O
June O
30 O
" " O
is O
also O
available O
" " O
without O
charge O
and O
upon O
request O
by O
calling O
the O
Fund O
at O
( O
212 O
) O
883-2750 O
or O
by O
accessing O
the O
Fund O
s O
Form I-MISC
N-PX I-MISC
on O
the O
Commission O
s O
website O
at O
http O
: O
//www.sec.gov O
. O

The O
Fund O
will O
file O
its O
complete O
schedule O
of O
portfolio O
holdings O
with O
the O
Securities I-GOVERNMENT
& I-GOVERNMENT
Exchange I-GOVERNMENT
Commission I-GOVERNMENT
for O
the O
first O
and O
third O
quarters O
of O
each O
fiscal O
year O
on O
Form I-MISC
N-Q I-MISC
. O

The O
Fund O
s O
Forms I-MISC
N-Q I-MISC
are O
available O
on O
the O
SEC I-GOVERNMENT
website O
at O
http O
: O
//www.sec.gov O
. O

The O
Fund O
s O
Forms I-MISC
N-Q I-MISC
may O
also O
be O
reviewed O
and O
copied O
at O
the O
Commission O
s O
Public I-LOC
Reference I-LOC
Room I-LOC
in O
Washington I-LOC
" " I-LOC

on O
the O

of O

FUND O
EXPENSES O
( O
unaudited O
) O
CLARION I-ORG
VALUE I-ORG
FUND I-ORG
MASTER I-ORG
" " I-ORG
LLC I-ORG
As O
a O
member O
of O
the O
Master O
Fund O
" " O
you O
incur O
two O
types O
of O
costs O
: O
( O
1 O
) O
transaction O
costs O
" " O
which O
may O
include O
sales O
charges O
( O
loads O
) O
on O
purchase O
payments O
" " O
contingent O
deferred O
sales O
charges O
on O
redemptions O
and O
( O
2 O
) O
ongoing O
costs O
" " O
including O
management O
fees O
and O
other O
Master O
Fund O
expenses O
. O

This O
example O
is O
intended O
to O
help O
you O
understand O
your O
ongoing O
costs O
( O
in O
dollars O
) O
of O
investing O
in O
the O
Master O
Fund O
and O
to O
compare O
these O
costs O
with O
the O
ongoing O
costs O
of O
investing O
in O
other O
mutual O
funds O
. O

The O
example O
is O
based O
on O
an O
investment O
of O
$ O
"1,000" O
invested O
at O
the O
beginning O
of O
the O
period O
and O
held O
for O
the O
entire O
period O
as O
indicated O
below O
. O

ACTUAL O
EXPENSES O
The O
first O
line O
of O
the O
table O
provides O
information O
about O
actual O
account O
values O
and O
actual O
expenses O
. O

You O
may O
use O
the O
information O
in O
this O
line O
" " O
together O
with O
the O
amount O
you O
invested O
" " O
to O
estimate O
the O
expenses O
that O
you O
paid O
over O
the O
period O
. O

Simply O
divide O
the O
account O
value O
by O
$ O
"1,000" O
( O
for O
example O
" " O
an O
$ O
"8,600" O
account O
value O
divided O
by O
$ O
"1,000" O
= O
8.6 O
) O
" " O
then O
multiply O
the O
result O
by O
the O
number O
in O
the O
first O
line O
under O
the O
heading O
entitled O
Expenses O
Paid O
During O
the O
Period O
to O
estimate O
the O
expenses O
you O
paid O
on O
your O
account O
during O
this O
period O
. O

HYPOTHETICAL O
EXAMPLE O
FOR O
COMPARISON O
PURPOSES O
The O
second O
line O
of O
the O
table O
below O
provides O
information O
about O
hypothetical O
account O
values O
and O
hypothetical O
expenses O
based O
on O
the O
Master O
Fund O
s O
actual O
expense O
ratio O
and O
an O
assumed O
annual O
rate O
of O
return O
of O
5 O
% O
before O
expenses O
" " O
which O
is O
not O
the O
Master O
Fund O
s O
actual O
return O
. O

The O
hypothetical O
account O
values O
and O
expenses O
may O
not O
be O
used O
to O
estimate O
the O
actual O
ending O
account O
balance O
or O
expenses O
you O
paid O
for O
the O
period O
. O

You O
may O
use O
this O
information O
to O
compare O
the O
ongoing O
costs O
of O
investing O
in O
the O
Master O
Fund O
and O
other O
funds O
by O
comparing O
this O
5 O
% O
hypothetical O
example O
with O
the O
5 O
% O
hypothetical O
examples O
that O
appear O
in O
the O
shareholder O
reports O
of O
other O
funds O
. O

Please O
note O
that O
the O
expenses O
shown O
in O
the O
table O
are O
meant O
to O
highlight O
your O
ongoing O
costs O
only O
and O
do O
not O
reflect O
any O
transactional O
costs O
" " O
such O
as O
sales O
charges O
( O
loads O
) O
" " O
or O
contingent O
deferred O
sales O
charges O
on O
redemptions O
. O

Therefore O
" " O
the O
second O
line O
of O
the O
table O
is O
useful O
in O
comparing O
ongoing O
costs O
only O
" " O
and O
will O
not O
help O
you O
determine O
the O
relative O
total O
costs O
of O
owning O
different O
funds O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
if O
these O
transactional O
costs O
were O
included O
" " O
your O
costs O
would O
have O
been O
higher O
. O

RUSSELL I-ORG
2000® I-ORG
2X I-ORG
STRATEGY I-ORG
FUND I-ORG
IMPORTANT O
INFORMATION O
ABOUT O
THE O
FUND O
The O
Russell I-ORG
2000® I-ORG
2x I-ORG
Strategy I-ORG
Fund I-ORG
( O
the O
`` O
Fund O
'' O
) O
is O
very O
different O
from O
most O
other O
mutual O
funds O
in O
that O
it O
seeks O
daily O
leveraged O
investment O
results O
. O

As O
a O
result O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
be O
riskier O
than O
alternatives O
that O
do O
not O
use O
leverage O
because O
the O
performance O
of O
an O
investment O
is O
magnified O
. O

The O
effect O
of O
leverage O
on O
the O
Fund O
will O
generally O
cause O
the O
Fund O
's O
performance O
to O
not O
match O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
Fund O
's O
benchmark O
( O
as O
defined O
below O
) O
over O
a O
period O
of O
time O
greater O
than O
one O
day O
. O

This O
means O
that O
the O
return O
of O
the O
Fund O
for O
a O
period O
of O
longer O
than O
a O
single O
trading O
day O
will O
be O
the O
result O
of O
each O
day O
's O
compounded O
returns O
over O
the O
period O
" " O
which O
will O
very O
likely O
differ O
from O
twice O
the O
return O
of O
the O
Fund O
's O
underlying O
index O
( O
as O
defined O
below O
) O
for O
that O
period O
. O

As O
a O
consequence O
" " O
especially O
in O
periods O
of O
market O
volatility O
" " O
the O
path O
or O
trend O
of O
the O
benchmark O
during O
the O
longer O
period O
may O
be O
at O
least O
as O
important O
to O
the O
Fund O
's O
cumulative O
return O
for O
the O
longer O
period O
as O
the O
cumulative O
return O
of O
the O
benchmark O
for O
the O
relevant O
longer O
period O
. O

Further O
" " O
the O
return O
for O
investors O
who O
invest O
for O
a O
period O
longer O
than O
a O
single O
trading O
day O
will O
not O
be O
the O
product O
of O
the O
return O
of O
the O
Fund O
's O
stated O
investment O
goal O
( O
e.g. O
" " O
2x O
) O
and O
the O
cumulative O
performance O
of O
the O
underlying O
index O
( O
as O
defined O
below O
) O
. O

The O
Fund O
is O
not O
suitable O
for O
all O
investors O
. O

The O
Fund O
should O
be O
utilized O
only O
by O
investors O
who O
( O
a O
) O
understand O
the O
risks O
associated O
with O
the O
use O
of O
leverage O
" " O
( O
b O
) O
understand O
the O
consequences O
of O
seeking O
daily O
leveraged O
investment O
results O
" " O
and O
( O
c O
) O
intend O
to O
actively O
monitor O
and O
manage O
their O
investments O
. O

Investors O
who O
do O
not O
meet O
these O
criteria O
should O
not O
buy O
shares O
of O
the O
Fund O
. O

An O
investment O
in O
the O
Fund O
is O
not O
a O
complete O
investment O
program O
. O

INVESTMENT O
OBJECTIVE O
The O
Fund O
seeks O
to O
provide O
investment O
results O
that O
match O
" " O
before O
fees O
and O
expenses O
" " O
the O
performance O
of O
a O
specific O
benchmark O
on O
a O
daily O
basis O
. O

The O
Fund O
's O
current O
benchmark O
is O
200 O
% O
of O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
Russell I-MISC
2000® I-MISC
Index I-MISC
( O
the O
`` O
underlying O
index O
'' O
) O
. O

The O
Fund O
does O
not O
seek O
to O
achieve O
its O
investment O
objective O
over O
a O
period O
of O
time O
greater O
than O
one O
day O
. O

AND O
EXPENSES O
OF O
THE O
FUND O
This O
table O
describes O
the O
fees O
and O
expenses O
that O
you O
may O
pay O
if O
you O
buy O
and O

shares O
of O
the O

of O
variable O

and O

contracts O
that O

in O

Fund O
should O
refer O
to O
the O
variable O
insurance O
contract O
prospectus O
for O
a O
description O
of O
fees O
and O
expenses O
since O
the O
`` O
Fund O
Fees O
and O
Expenses O
'' O
table O
and O
`` O
Example O
'' O
information O
does O
not O
reflect O
deductions O
at O
the O

account O
level O
or O
contract O
level O
for O
any O
charges O
that O
may O
be O
incurred O
under O
a O
contract O
. O

If O
this O

were O
to O
reflect O
the O
deduction O
of O
insurance O
charges O
" " O

and O
expenses O
would O
be O
higher O
. O

EXAMPLE O
This O
Example O
is O
intended O
to O
help O
you O
compare O
the O

of O
investing O
in O
the O
Fund O
with O
the O
cost O
of O
investing O
in O
other O
mutual O
funds O
. O

The O
Example O
assumes O
that O
you O
invest O
$ O
"10,000" O
in O
the O
Fund O
for O
the O
time O
periods O
indicated O
" " O
and O
then O
redeem O
all O
of O
your O
shares O
at O
the O

of O
those O
periods O
. O

The O

also O
assumes O
that O
your O

has O
a O
5 O
% O
return O
each O
year O
and O
that O
the O
Fund O
's O

remain O
the O

. O

Although O
your O
actual O
costs O
may O
be O
higher O
or O
lower O
" " O
based O
on O
these O
assumptions O
your O
costs O
would O
be O
: O

PORTFOLIO O
TURNOVER O
The O
Fund O
pays O
transaction O
costs O
" " O
such O
as O
commissions O
" " O
when O
it O
buys O
and O
sells O
securities O
( O
or O
`` O
turns O
over O
'' O
its O
portfolio O
) O
. O

A O
higher O
portfolio O
turnover O
rate O
may O
indicate O
higher O
transaction O
costs O
and O
may O
result O
in O
higher O
taxes O
when O
Fund O
shares O
are O
held O
in O
a O
taxable O
account O
. O

These O
costs O
" " O
which O
are O
not O
reflected O
in O
Total O
Annual O
Fund O
Operating O
Expenses O
or O
in O
the O
Example O
" " O
affect O
the O
Fund O
's O
performance O
. O

During O
the O
most O
recent O
fiscal O
year O
" " O
the O
Fund O
's O
portfolio O
turnover O
rate O
was O
100 O
% O
of O
the O
average O
value O
of O
its O
portfolio O
. O

However O
" " O
the O
Fund O
's O
portfolio O
turnover O
rate O
is O
calculated O
without O
regard O
to O
cash O
instruments O
or O
derivatives O
. O

If O
such O
instruments O
were O
included O
" " O
the O
Fund O
's O
portfolio O
turnover O
rate O
might O
be O
significantly O
higher O
. O

PRINCIPAL O
INVESTMENT O
STRATEGIES O
The O
Fund O
employs O
as O
its O
investment O
strategy O
a O
program O
of O
investing O
in O
the O
common O
stock O
of O
companies O
that O
are O
generally O
within O
the O
capitalization O
range O
of O
the O
underlying O
index O
and O
derivative O
instruments O
" " O
which O
primarily O
consist O
of O
equity O
index O
swaps O
" " O
futures O
contracts O
" " O
and O
options O
on O
securities O
" " O
futures O
contracts O
" " O
and O
stock O
indices O
. O

Equity O
index O
swaps O
and O
futures O
and O
options O
contracts O
" " O
if O
used O
properly O
" " O
may O
enable O
the O
Fund O
to O
meet O
its O
objective O
by O
increasing O
the O
Fund O
's O
exposure O
to O
the O
securities O
included O
in O
the O
underlying O
index O
or O
in O
the O
same O
proportion O
that O
those O
securities O
are O
represented O
in O
the O
underlying O
index O
. O

Under O
normal O
circumstances O
" " O
the O
Fund O
will O
invest O
at O
least O
80 O
% O
of O
its O
net O
assets O
" " O
plus O
any O
borrowings O
for O
investment O
purposes O
" " O
in O
financial O
instruments O
with O
economic O
characteristics O
that O
should O
perform O
similarly O
to O
the O
securities O
of O
companies O
in O
the O
underlying O
index O
. O

Certain O
of O
the O
Fund O
's O
derivative O
investments O
may O
be O
traded O
in O
the O
over-the-counter O
( O
`` O
OTC O
'' O
) O
market O
. O

The O
Russell I-MISC
2000® I-MISC
Index I-MISC
is O
composed O
of O
the O
"2,000" O
smallest O
companies O
in O
the O
Russell I-MISC
3000® I-MISC
Index I-MISC
" " O
representing O
approximately O
10 O
% O
of O
the O
Russell I-MISC
3000® I-MISC
total O
market O
capitalization O
and O
consisting O
of O
capitalizations O
ranging O
from O
$ O
24 O
million O
to O
$ O
5.3 O
billion O
as O
of O
December O
31 O
" " O
2010 O
. O

The O
Russell I-MISC
3000® I-MISC
Index I-MISC
is O
composed O
of O
the O
"3,000" O
largest O
U.S. I-LOC
companies O
ranked O
by O
total O
market O
capitalization O
" " O
representing O
approximately O
98 O
% O
of O
the O
U.S. I-LOC
investable O
equity O
market O
. O

On O
a O
day-to-day O
basis O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
hold O
U.S. I-LOC
Government O
securities O
or O
cash O
equivalents O
to O
collateralize O
its O
derivative O
positions O
. O

In O
an O
effort O
to O
ensure O
that O
the O
Fund O
is O
fully O
invested O
on O
a O
day-to-day O
basis O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
conduct O
any O
necessary O
trading O
activity O
at O
or O
just O
prior O
to O
the O
close O
of O
the O
U.S. I-LOC
to O
the O
extent O
the O
Fund O
's O
underlying O
index O
is O
concentrated O
in O
a O
particular O
industry O
the O
Fund O
will O
necessarily O
be O
concentrated O
in O
that O
industry O
. O

The O
Fund O
is O
non-diversified O
and O
" " O
therefore O
" " O
may O
invest O
a O
greater O
percentage O
of O
its O
assets O
in O
a O
particular O
issuer O
in O
comparison O
to O
a O
diversified O
fund O
. O

PRINCIPAL O
RISKS O
As O
with O
all O
mutual O
funds O
" " O
a O
shareholder O
is O
subject O
to O
the O
risk O
that O
his O
or O
her O
investment O
could O
lose O
money O
. O

In O
addition O
to O
this O
risk O
" " O
the O
Fund O
is O
subject O
to O
a O
number O
of O
additional O
risks O
that O
may O
affect O
the O
value O
of O
its O
shares O
" " O
including O
: O
Active O
Trading O
Risk O
Active O
trading O
" " O
also O
called O
`` O
high O
portfolio O
turnover O
" " O
'' O
may O
result O
in O
higher O
brokerage O
costs O
or O
mark-up O
charges O
" " O
which O
may O
negatively O
affect O
Fund O
performance O
and O
result O
in O
short-term O
capital O
gains O
" " O
which O
have O
a O
negative O
tax O
effect O
. O

Large O
movements O
of O
assets O
into O
and O
out O
of O
the O
Fund O
due O
to O
active O
trading O
also O
may O
adversely O
affect O
the O
Fund O
's O
ability O
to O
achieve O
its O
investment O
objective O
. O

Correlation O
and O
Compounding O
Risk O
A O
number O
of O
factors O
may O
affect O
the O
Fund O
's O
ability O
to O
achieve O
a O
high O
degree O
of O
correlation O
with O
its O
benchmark O
" " O
and O
there O
can O
be O
no O
guarantee O
that O
the O
Fund O
will O
achieve O
a O
high O
degree O
of O
correlation O
. O

Failure O
to O
achieve O
a O
high O
degree O
of O
correlation O
may O
prevent O
the O
Fund O
from O
achieving O
its O
investment O
objective O
. O

The O
risk O
of O
the O
Fund O
not O
achieving O
its O
daily O
investment O
objective O
will O
be O
more O
acute O
when O
the O
underlying O
index O
has O
an O
extreme O
one-day O
movement O
approaching O
50 O
% O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
as O
a O
result O
of O
compounding O
" " O
the O
Fund O
's O
performance O
for O
periods O
greater O
than O
one O
day O
is O
likely O
to O
be O
either O
greater O
than O
or O
less O
than O
the O
performance O
of O
the O
underlying O
index O
times O
the O
stated O
multiple O
in O
the O
Fund O
's O
investment O
objective O
" " O
before O
accounting O
for O
fees O
and O
fund O
expenses O
. O

Compounding O
affects O
all O
investments O
" " O
but O
has O
a O
more O
significant O
impact O
on O
a O
leveraged O
index O
fund O
. O

In O
general O
" " O
particularly O
during O
periods O
of O
higher O
index O
volatility O
" " O
compounding O
will O
cause O
longer-term O
results O
to O
be O
more O
or O
less O
than O
the O
return O
of O
the O
Fund O
's O
benchmark O
. O

This O
effect O
becomes O
more O
pronounced O
as O
volatility O
increases O
. O

Fund O
performance O
for O
periods O
greater O
than O
one O
day O
can O
be O
estimated O
given O
any O
set O
of O
assumptions O
for O
the O
following O
factors O
: O
( O
a O
) O
underlying O
index O
performance O
; O
( O
b O
) O
underlying O
index O
volatility O
; O
( O
c O
) O
financing O
rates O
associated O
with O
leverage O
; O
( O
d O
) O
other O
Fund O
expenses O
; O
( O
e O
) O
dividends O
paid O
by O
companies O
in O
the O
underlying O
index O
; O
and O
( O
f O
) O
period O
of O
time O
. O

The O
chart O
below O
illustrates O
the O
impact O
of O
two O
principal O
factors O
 O
volatility O
and O
index O
performance O
 O
on O
Fund O
performance O
. O

The O
chart O
shows O
estimated O
Fund O
returns O
for O
a O
number O
of O

of O
performance O
and O

over O

period O
. O

companies O
included O
in O
the O

; O

) O

; O

Counterparty O
Credit O
Risk O
The O
Fund O
may O
make O
investments O
in O
financial O
instruments O
involving O
counterparties O
that O
attempt O
to O
gain O
exposure O
to O
a O
particular O
group O
of O
securities O
" " O
index O
or O
asset O
class O
without O
actually O
purchasing O
those O
securities O
or O
investments O
" " O
or O
to O
hedge O
a O
position O
. O

The O
Fund O
's O
use O
of O
such O
financial O
instruments O
" " O
including O
swap O
agreements O
" " O
involves O
risks O
that O
are O
different O
from O
those O
associated O
with O
ordinary O
portfolio O
securities O
transactions O
. O

For O
example O
" " O
if O
a O
swap O
agreement O
counterparty O
defaults O
on O
its O
payment O
obligations O
to O
the O
Fund O
" " O
this O
default O
will O
cause O
the O
value O
of O
your O
investment O
in O
the O
Fund O
to O
decrease O
. O

Swap O
agreements O
also O
may O
be O
considered O
to O
be O
illiquid O
. O

Derivatives O
Risk O
The O
Fund O
's O
investments O
in O
derivatives O
may O
pose O
risks O
in O
addition O
to O
those O
associated O
with O
investing O
directly O
in O
securities O
or O
other O
investments O
" " O
including O
illiquidity O
of O
the O
derivatives O
" " O
imperfect O
correlations O
with O
underlying O
investments O
or O
the O
Fund O
's O
other O
portfolio O
holdings O
" " O
lack O
of O
availability O
and O
counterparty O
risk O
. O

Early O
Closing O
Risk O
The O
Fund O
is O
subject O
to O
the O
risk O
that O
unanticipated O
early O
closings O
of O
securities O
exchanges O
and O
other O
financial O
markets O
may O
result O
in O
the O
Fund O
's O
inability O
to O
buy O
or O
sell O
securities O
or O
other O
financial O
instruments O
on O
that O
day O
and O
may O
cause O
the O
Fund O
to O
incur O
substantial O
trading O
losses O
. O

Leveraging O
Risk O
The O
Fund O
achieves O
leveraged O
exposure O
to O
the O
underlying O
index O
through O
the O
use O
of O
derivative O
instruments O
. O

The O
Fund O
's O
investment O
in O
these O
instruments O
generally O
requires O
a O
small O
investment O
relative O
to O
the O
amount O
of O
investment O
exposure O
assumed O
. O

As O
a O
result O
" " O
such O
investments O
may O
give O
rise O
to O
losses O
that O
exceed O
the O
amount O
invested O
in O
those O
instruments O
. O

The O
more O
the O
Fund O
invests O
in O
leveraged O
instruments O
" " O
the O
more O
this O
leverage O
will O
magnify O
any O
losses O
on O
those O
investments O
. O

Since O
the O
Fund O
's O
investment O
strategy O
involves O
consistently O
applied O
leverage O
" " O
the O
value O
of O
the O
Fund O
's O
shares O
will O
tend O
to O
increase O
or O
decrease O
more O
than O
the O
value O
of O
any O
increase O
or O
decrease O
in O
the O
underlying O
index O
. O

Leverage O
also O
will O
have O
the O
effect O
of O
magnifying O
tracking O
error O
. O

Liquidity O
Risk O
In O
certain O
circumstances O
" " O
it O
may O
be O
difficult O
for O
the O
Fund O
to O
purchase O
and O
sell O
particular O
investments O
within O
a O
reasonable O
time O
at O
a O
fair O
price O
. O

In O
addition O
" " O
the O
ability O
of O
the O
Fund O
to O
assign O
an O
accurate O
daily O
value O
to O
certain O
investments O
may O
be O
difficult O
" " O
and O
the O
Advisor O
may O
be O
required O
to O
fair O
value O
the O
investments O
. O

Market O
Risk O
The O
Fund O
's O
investments O
in O
securities O
and O
derivatives O
" " O
in O
general O
" " O
are O
subject O
to O
market O
risks O
that O
may O
cause O
their O
prices O
" " O
and O
therefore O
the O
Fund O
's O
value O
" " O
to O
fluctuate O
over O
time O
. O

An O
investment O
in O
the O
Fund O
may O
lose O
money O
. O

Non-Diversification O
Risk O
The O
Fund O
is O
considered O
non-diversified O
and O
can O
invest O
a O
greater O
portion O
of O
its O
assets O
in O
securities O
of O
individual O
issuers O
than O
a O
diversified O
fund O
. O

As O
a O
result O
" " O
changes O
in O
the O
market O
value O
of O
a O
single O
security O
could O
cause O
greater O
fluctuations O
in O
the O
value O
of O
Fund O
shares O
than O
would O
occur O
in O
a O
diversified O
fund O
. O

OTC O
Trading O
Risk O
Certain O
of O
the O
derivatives O
in O
which O
the O
Fund O
may O
invest O
may O
be O
traded O
( O
and O
privately O
negotiated O
) O
in O
the O
OTC O
market O
. O

While O
the O
OTC O
derivatives O
market O
is O
the O
primary O
trading O
venue O
for O
many O
derivatives O
" " O
it O
is O
largely O
unregulated O
. O

As O
a O
result O
and O
similar O
to O
other O
privately O
negotiated O
contracts O
" " O
the O
Fund O
is O
subject O
to O
counterparty O
credit O
risk O
with O
respect O
to O
such O
derivative O
contracts O
. O

Passive O
Investment O
Risk O
The O
Fund O
is O
not O
actively O
managed O
and O
the O
Advisor O
does O
not O
attempt O
to O
take O
defensive O
positions O
in O
declining O
markets O
. O

Therefore O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
be O
subject O
to O
greater O
losses O
in O
a O
declining O
market O
than O
a O
fund O
that O
is O
actively O
managed O
. O

Small-Capitalization O
Securities O
Risk O
The O
Fund O
is O
subject O
to O
the O
risk O
that O
small-capitalization O
stocks O
may O
underperform O
other O
segments O
of O
the O
equity O
market O
or O
the O
equity O
market O
as O
a O
whole O
. O

Tracking O
Error O
Risk O
The O
Advisor O
may O
not O
be O
able O
to O
cause O
the O
Fund O
's O
performance O
to O
match O
that O
of O
the O
Fund O
's O
benchmark O
" " O
either O
on O
a O
daily O
or O
aggregate O
basis O
. O

Factors O
such O
as O
Fund O
expenses O
" " O
imperfect O
correlation O
between O
the O
Fund O
's O
investments O
and O
those O
of O
the O
underlying O
index O
" " O
rounding O
of O
share O
prices O
" " O
changes O
to O
the O
composition O
of O
the O
underlying O
index O
" " O
regulatory O
policies O
" " O
high O
portfolio O
turnover O
rate O
and O
the O
use O
of O
leverage O
all O
contribute O
to O
tracking O
error O
. O

Tracking O
error O
may O
cause O
the O
Fund O
's O
performance O
to O
be O
less O
than O
you O
expect O
. O

Trading O
Halt O
Risk O
If O
a O
trading O
halt O
occurs O
" " O
the O
Fund O
may O
temporarily O
be O
unable O
to O
purchase O
or O
sell O
securities O
" " O
options O
or O
futures O
contracts O
. O

Such O

halt O
near O
the O
time O

Fund O
prices O

shares O
may O

the O

to O

and O
may O

the O
Fund O
from O

. O

INFORMATION O

over O
different O

of O

to O

of O
a O

. O

. O

Of O
course O
" " O

OF O
FUND O

of O
the O
Fund O

by O

companies O
for O
their O
separate O
accounts O
to O
fund O
variable O
life O
insurance O
and O
variable O
annuity O
contracts O
. O

All O

for O
the O

of O
shares O
are O
subject O
to O

or O

by O
the O
Trust O
. O

An O

company O
purchases O
and O

shares O
of O

based O
on O
" " O

other O

" " O

of O

or O

payments O

to O
a O

account O
investment O
division O
" " O
transfers O
to O
or O
from O
a O
separate O
account O
investment O
division O
" " O
contract O
loans O
and O
repayment O
" " O
contract O
withdrawals O
and O
surrenders O
" " O
and O

payments O
" " O
at O
the O
Fund O
's O
NAV O
per O
share O
calculated O
as O
of O
that O
same O
day O
. O

be O
processed O
and O
payment O
with O
respect O
thereto O
will O

. O

official O
closing O
price O
; O
and O
securities O
traded O
in O
the O
over-the-counter O
market O
and O
listed O
securities O
for O
which O
no O
sale O
is O
reported O
on O
that O
date O
are O
valued O
at O
the O
last O
reported O
bid O
price O
. O

It O
is O
expected O
that O
fixed O
income O
securities O
will O
ordinarily O
be O
traded O
in O
the O
over-the-counter O
market O
. O

When O
market O
quotations O
are O
not O
readily O
available O
" " O
fixed O
income O
securities O
may O
be O
valued O
on O
the O
basis O
of O
prices O
provided O
by O
an O
independent O
pricing O
service O
. O

Other O
assets O
and O
securities O
for O
which O
no O
quotations O
are O
readily O
available O
or O
for O
which O
quotations O
the O
Advisor O
believes O
do O
not O
reflect O
market O
value O
are O
valued O
at O
their O
fair O
value O
as O
determined O
in O
good O
faith O
by O
the O
Advisor O
unde O
r O
the O
procedures O
established O
by O
the O
Board O
of O
Trustees O
. O

Short-term O
investments O
may O
be O
valued O
at O
amortized O
cost O
which O
approximates O
market O
value O
. O

Semiconductor I-ORG
Corporation I-ORG
( O
NASDAQ I-ORG
: O

) O
enables O
serial O

most O
complete O

" " O

's O

" " O

" " O

with O
its O
SaRonix-eCERA I-MISC

" " O
switching O
" " O

high-speed O

today O

Indemnification O
of O
Directors O
and O
Officers O
. O

Under O

agreement O
" " O

most O
circumstances O
" " O

will O

the O
following O
persons O
" " O
to O
the O
fullest O
extent O
permitted O
by O
law O
" " O
from O
and O
against O
all O
losses O
" " O
claims O
" " O
damages O

similar O
events O
: O

Any O
indemnification O
under O
these O
provisions O
will O
only O
be O
out O
of O
our O
assets O
. O

We O
also O
have O
indemnification O
agreements O
with O
our O
executive O
officers O
and O
directors O
. O

Pursuant O
to O
such O

agreements O
" " O
we O
have O
agreed O
to O

our O
executive O
officers O

directors O
against O
certain O
liabilities O
. O

" " O

will O
not O

personally O

for O
" " O
or O

or O
loan O

or O
assets O
to O

to O
enable O

to O
effectuate O

indemnification O

" " O

. O

We O
are O
in O
the O
business O
of O

. O

On O
March O
31st O
" " O
2011 O
Northumberland I-ORG
( O
NHUR I-ORG
) O
was O
a O
successful O
bidder O
at O
the O
Evenson I-MISC
Oil I-MISC
Production I-MISC
Auction I-MISC
in O
Wichita I-LOC
" " O
Kansas I-LOC
. O

NHUR I-ORG
acquired O
the O
Mason I-MISC
" " I-MISC
Thompson I-MISC
" " I-MISC
Keyes I-MISC
and I-MISC
Harrell I-MISC
leases O

of O
all O

and O

. O

were O

at O

from O
REH I-ORG

& I-ORG

. O

The O
leases O
of O
280 O

in O

in O
Pratt I-LOC
County I-LOC
Kansas B-LOC

" " O

were O

. O

( O

) O
. O

Pursuant O
to O
a O
securities O
lending O
agreement O
with O
The I-ORG
Bank I-ORG
of I-ORG
New I-ORG
York I-ORG
Mellon I-ORG
" " O
a O
subsidiary O
of O
BNY I-ORG
Mellon I-ORG
and O
an O
affiliate O
of O
Dreyfus I-ORG
" " O
the O
fund O
may O
lend O
securities O
to O
qualified O
institutions O
. O

It O
is O
the O
fund O
s O
policy O
that O
" " O
at O
origination O
" " O
all O
loans O
are O
secured O
by O
collateral O
of O
at O
least O
102 O
% O
of O
the O
value O
of O
U.S. I-LOC
securities O
loaned O
and O
105 O
% O
of O
the O
value O
of O
foreign O
securities O
loaned O
. O

Collateral O
equivalent O
to O
at O
least O
100 O
% O
of O
the O
market O
value O
of O
securities O
on O
loan O
is O
maintained O
at O
all O
times O
. O

Collateral O
is O
either O
in O
the O
form O
of O
cash O
" " O
which O
can O
be O
invested O
in O
certain O
money O
market O
mutual O
funds O
managed O
by O
the O
Manager O
" " O
U.S. I-LOC
Government O
and O
Agency O
securities O
or O
letters O
of O
credit O
. O

The O
fund O
is O
entitled O
to O
receive O
all O
income O
on O
securities O
loaned O
" " O
in O
addition O
to O
income O
earned O
as O
a O
result O
of O
the O
lending O
transaction O
. O

Although O
each O
security O
loaned O
is O
fully O
collateralized O
" " O
the O
fund O
bears O
the O
risk O
of O
delay O
in O
recovery O
of O
" " O
or O
loss O
of O
rights O
in O
" " O
the O
securities O
loaned O
should O
a O
borrower O
fail O
to O
return O
the O
securities O
in O
a O
timely O
manner O
. O

The O
fund O
adopted O
the O
provisions O
of O
ASC O
Topic O
815 O
Derivatives O
and O
Hedging O
which O
requires O
qualitative O
disclosures O
about O
objectives O
and O
strategies O
for O
using O
derivatives O
" " O
quantitative O
disclosures O
about O
fair O
value O
amounts O
of O
gains O
and O
losses O
on O
derivative O
instruments O
and O
disclosures O
about O
credit-risk-related O
contingent O
features O
in O
derivative O
agreements O
. O

The O
disclosure O
requirements O
distinguish O
between O
derivatives O
" " O
which O
are O
accounted O
for O
as O
hedges O
and O
those O
that O
do O
not O
qualify O
for O
hedge O
accounting O
. O

Because O
investment O
companies O
value O
their O
derivatives O
at O
fair O
value O
and O
recognize O
changes O
in O
fair O
value O
through O
the O
Statement O
of O
Operations O
" " O
they O
do O
not O
qualify O
for O
such O
accounting O
. O

Accordingly O
" " O
even O
though O
a O
fund O
s O
investments O
in O
derivatives O
may O
represent O
economic O
hedges O
" " O
they O
are O
considered O
to O
be O
non-hedge O
transactions O
for O
purposes O
of O
this O
disclosure O
. O

Futures O
Contracts O
: O
In O
the O
normal O
course O
of O
pursuing O
its O
investment O
objective O
" " O
the O
fund O
is O
exposed O
to O
market O
risk O
" " O
including O
equity O
price O
risk O
" " O

as O
a O
result O
of O
changes O
in O
value O
of O
underlying O
financial O
instruments O
. O

The O
fund O
may O
invest O
in O
financial O
futures O
contracts O
in O
order O
to O
manage O
its O
exposure O
to O
or O
protect O
against O
changes O
in O
the O
market O
. O

A O
futures O
contract O
represents O
a O
commitment O
for O
the O
future O
purchase O
or O
a O
sale O
of O
an O
asset O
at O
a O
specified O
date O
. O

Upon O
entering O
into O
such O
contracts O
" " O
these O
investments O
require O
initial O
margin O
deposits O
with O
a O
broker O
" " O
which O
consist O
of O
cash O
or O
cash O
equivalents O
. O

The O
amount O
of O
these O
deposits O
is O
determined O
by O
the O
exchange O
or O
Board O
of O
Trade O
on O
which O
the O
contract O
is O
traded O
and O
is O
subject O
to O
change O
. O

Accordingly O
" " O
variation O
margin O
payments O
are O
received O
or O
made O
to O
reflect O
daily O
unrealized O
gains O
or O
losses O
which O
are O
recorded O
in O
the O
Statement O
of O
Operations O
. O

Futures O
contracts O
are O
valued O
daily O
at O
the O
settlement O
price O
established O
by O
the O
Board O
of O
Trade O
or O
exchange O
upon O
which O
they O
are O
traded O
. O

When O
the O
contracts O
are O
closed O
" " O
the O
fund O
recognizes O
a O
realized O
gain O
or O
loss O
. O

There O
is O
minimal O
counterparty O
credit O
risk O
to O
the O
fund O
with O
futures O
" " O
since O
futures O
are O
exchange O
traded O
and O
the O
exchange O
s O
clearinghouse O
" " O
as O
counterparty O
to O
all O
exchange O
traded O
futures O
" " O
guarantees O
the O
futures O
against O
default O
. O

Additional O
investment O
related O
disclosures O
are O
hereby O
incorporated O
by O
reference O
to O
the O
annual O
and O
semi-annual O
reports O
previously O
filed O
with O
the O
Securities I-GOVERNMENT
and I-GOVERNMENT
Exchange I-GOVERNMENT
Commission I-GOVERNMENT
on O
Form I-MISC
N-CSR I-MISC

Prophage I-MISC

( O

; O

in O

cancer O
 O

a O

from O
this O
trial O
showed O
that O
93 O
% O
of O

patients O
were O
alive O
at O
26 O
weeks O
after O
surgery O
and O
a O

11 O
months O
( O
47.6 O
weeks O
) O
. O

Results O
from O
pre-defined O

analyses O
of O
disease O
progression O

a O
median O
progression O

of O

5 O

( O
20 O
weeks O

. O

" " O
measures O
of O

response O
post O

with O

G-200 I-MISC

T-cell I-MISC
response O
as O

The O

of O

Series I-MISC

" " O

. O

The O
primary O

of O

trial O
was O
to O
assess O
the O
survival O
rate O
at O
26 O
weeks O
" " O
which O
represents O
the O
average O
survival O
time O
for O
patients O
experiencing O
recurrence O
of O
their O
GBM I-MISC
. O

Results O
from O
this O

showed O
that O
93 O
% O
of O
the O
patients O
were O
alive O
at O
26 O
weeks O
after O
surgery O
and O
a O
median O
overall O
survival O
of O
11 O
months O
( O
47.6 O
weeks O
) O
. O

Results O
from O
pre-defined O
exploratory O
analyses O
of O
disease O
progression O
showed O
a O
median O
progression O
free O
survival O
( O
PFS O
) O
of O
approximately O
5 O
months O
( O
20 O
weeks O
) O
. O

Importantly O
" " O
measures O
of O
immune O
response O
post O
vaccination O
with O
Prophage I-MISC
Series I-MISC
G-200 I-MISC
demonstrated O
a O
significant O
tumor-specific O
CD8+ I-MISC
T-cell I-MISC
response O
as O
well O
as O
innate O
immune O
responses O
as O
marked O
by O
a O
significant O
increase O
in O
levels O
of O
circulating O
NK I-MISC
cells I-MISC
. O

The O
robust O
immune O
response O
coupled O
with O
improved O
survival O
relative O
to O
historical O
controls O
makes O
the O
data O
from O
this O

especially O

. O

The O
safety O
profile O
of O
HSPPC-96 I-MISC
offers O
a O
great O
opportunity O
for O

in O

for O

Andrew I-PER

No O
related O

on O

from O

recent O
